Reviews.Title: “Best experience!”
Reviews.Author: atltoca
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my fiance's 40th birthday in New York, and opted for this hotel, as the price was very reasonable and the location excellent. I called ahead, and spoke with the general manager, Marcos, and he really made our trip fantastic! He upgraded the room, and had balloons, cupcakes and champagne waiting for us (at no extra charge)! The service was perfect, everyone was very accommodating. The location provided easy access to subways, and walking distance to times square and broadway shows. I would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel located close to restaurant row”
Reviews.Author: Danny A
Reviews.Content: On the day we flew to New York City, I had a torn ligament on my right leg and I had a hard time walking. Four Points Time Square had me use their wheelchair for the entire 5 days we stayed. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Bathroom is spacious but mixing the hot/cold water in the shower and faucet are challenging. I will consider staying on this hotel whenever I am in New York because of the location, walking distance to theaters, restaurants, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: mcarey5543
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Sheraton Towers, W or the Westin Times Square, but those were sold out, so I tried the Four Point Times Square out - and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are clean, new and just as nice as the other hotels. The staff was friendly and efficient and the breakfast was very good. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: Bevanstraveller
Reviews.Content: Recently, my family and I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Midtown (March 17-20, 2012). The room is very clean, although small. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The view from the upper floors is nice, however the view from the lower floors isn't ideal. The hotel is situated between the Port Authority Bus Terminal and a old decrepid factory. The hotel is also next to a New York State Parole office, however we never felt unsafe when we walked past that building. I would stay there again if I travel back to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a central but not very attractive location”
Reviews.Author: George73Greek
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent a 7 day holiday in New York in March 2012. The hotel is in a central location with easy access to the subway, and the Port Authority Bus Station (buses from and to Newark Airport, and Woodbury Commons). The public areas of the hotel are fine, and the rooms - although pretty small - are very nice. The staff at the reception are friendly and helpful. The area surrounding the hotel is very noisy, and can be dodgy at night. Although we did not have any incidents to report, the overall feel and look was rather unpleasant. Moreover, the level of the noise is quite high (even in higher floors, since constructions are taking place).

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel but a few misses”
Reviews.Author: WesDallas
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel I decided to try out. As hotels go this is nice but there are few simple but serious issues with it. 1) no wireless network available on the 17th floor. They gave me a code but could only find a signal in the lobby. 2) I tried to call the front deck twice but could never get an answer. 3) you would think hotels would realize people want to charge their phones by the bed. Good luck here. You can crawl under a bed side table anchored to the wall and unplug a light but lights are nice things also 4) there is a small bar down stairs but could never find anyone to serve me anything & 5) if you are a starwood member, there is no club ( the four points on Chelsa has a great club)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: xjs_jag_girl
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a wonderful 5 night stay at this hotel. The staff were welcoming and very helpful and when the room allocated proved to have a king rather than 2 twin beds as expected it was sorted within minutes by the aptly named Angel on reception - thank you Angel. We had a north facing room overlooking the port authority bus terminal which some people find a negative, instead we saw it as a positive since it's only 2-3 storey high you get a good view from the higher floored hotel rooms from the Hudson river to the New York Times building. Twin room was spacious, bathroom with great sized shower, beds and pillows really comfortable and tea/coffee/water provided each day. Location of hotel is also a bonus for easy walking into the heart of midtown Manhattan. We didn't use the hotel restaurant as we prefer to eat out and my friend is on a strict gluten, yeast free diet. We found an excellent place for breakfast just a short stroll over the lights at 8th Av still on W40th called 'Telecon Cafe'. Great selection inc. porridge (oatmeal) with unlimited toppings for $3.95. For evening meals there's loads of great places on 9th Av. We went to 'Nizza' several times as it offers a full gluten-free menu and for my friend who craves bread, free corn bread whilst waiting for your main! The food is fantastic and very reasonably priced. Hotel concierge very helpful when it came to booking the return 'Go Link' mini bus back to Newark airport and staff kept baggage safe & secure whilst we enjoyed our last day in NYC until pick up time of 3pm. We couldn't have had a better stay and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: mexicanwannabe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Four Points Times Square. What a wonderful place to stay! The hotel staff are so nice and helpful- always smiling, ready to help with directions, even saying, "welcome back" when you return after exploring the city. The rooms are comfortable, although small from what I'm used to in the midwest, but standard size for New York. We were given a room on the 24th floor, which put us far away from the street noise. Our view, however, was not impressive- looking out over a roof of a building and at construction across the street. The beds are SO comfortable, as are the pillows. The hotel gives bottles of water daily, as well as coffee in the room. My only complaint would have to be the size of the bathroom- more the configuration. There is no counter space, which is a problem for 2 women sharing the bathroom! The hotel is right across the street from the Port Authority bus station, which is helpful if you want to take the express bus back to Newark Airport. There are subway stations conveniently located near the hotel. The ACE line is right there, and the NQR line is on the next block. You are about 2 blocks off of Times Square. Food in the hotel is very good, and they offer huge portions. There is a small bar in the lobby, although we didn't go there. They also have 2 computers in the lobby, offering free internet and printing (great for printing off boarding passes). I would definitely stay here again! Ask for Alex- he will help with anything!! My phone charger didn't work for some reason, and he even charged my phone for me. You won't go wrong staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in New York”
Reviews.Author: memorablegetaways
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just minutes from Time Square. The room was small but very clean. All of the staff we interacted with were very polite and helpful, especially the gentleman who checked us in. The food in the restaurant was very good. The service in the restaurant was a little slow. The fitness center was a typical hotel fitness center and served our needs. The location was great for us and we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything But The Employees”
Reviews.Author: howardlover
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, easy walking distance to the theaters and public transport. Room service was good. Unfortunately, an encounter with a very rude manager left me with an overwhelmingly negative opinion of this hotel. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Puppies07
Reviews.Content: We took the Metro North train into Grand Central Station. I had called the hotel earlier and they said it was a 10 min walk. It was a 20 min walk and maybe we took the wrong streets to get there but we were quite worried about the neighborhood we were walking through including the Patrol check in office right next door that was lined with convicts every morning. The hotel is just behind the Bus station and just one block over is in the middle of the best of times sqaure with shopping, restaurants and another block up times square. It is a block from the nearest subway station and from there we were able to navigate the city well enough. Just to go to the druf store down at the corner we felt we should walk in pairs. One of the days we stayed (2 night stay) we left the room at 8am and returned at 4pm wanting to take showers before we dressed for broadway show and dinner. Our room had not been serviced and we had no towels and had to call for them. they advertise free water, we had one bottle in our room at check in...doubt that covers as free water. we did not eat at the restaurant and the lobby lounge was very small. Prob about 20 seats. When we checked out they did let us store our luggage before heading our of town. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms though small were clean and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Let's talk about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaretChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: First the good...it's clean. Which is what every decent hotel should deliver and this one does. Now...I am actually staying at this hotel as I write. I have stayed here before....not for awhile, and many (not all but enough to comment upon) the same issues apply: 1.) last trip my room wouldn't heat up in very cold weather; this trip it won't cool down in unseasonably warm weather. 2.) For the money, the cheesy plastic glasses in the rooms are an insult. 3.) One of the elevators is broken down (again). 4.) the restaurant is closed, "for remodeling." 5.) long waits at the understaffed front desk. This is an SPG property? I guess so. One I won't stay in again. There is just not a good price/value relationship. Other chains do it so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larnerdarren
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel. Well situated for Times Square and midtown areas. Subway very close by. We had a four night stay here and it suited our needs. The room was on the 19th floor and traffic noise etc was fairly minimal. The air con was noisy though. We didn't eat here so can't comment on the food and the roof top bar was closed which was a shame.Coffee machine in room. Free internet including the use of a couple of PC's behind the reception/lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs new cleaners”
Reviews.Author: Kimmmmmm
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to times square and public transport. Small room, but expected in NYC. Cleaners were not great. Must've had dirty hands when they put the soap etc in our room. We stayed for a week too so it's not like it was a one off mistake

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and sufficiently sized, with a very comfortable bed and a great TV. The location is excellent for Times Square and the surrounding attractions, and despite this, the noise from outside is shut out, and the temperature can be controlled easily in the room with the heater / air conditioner. We slept very well every night. The free WIFI in the room also worked perfectly. The hotel may be large (31 floors if I remember right) but we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for a lift. The staff were polite and helpful. My only very slight downside was that the controls of the shower and tap took a bit of mastering to get the correct temperature and pressure. These should be made a little more idiot proof. I would definitely recommend this hotel though, and it will be top of my list should I be making a return visit to the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Fernando M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on a very good location, near Times Square and Subway. Rooms were very clear, comfortable and compact. Free wifi in the rooms made our life much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Brit C
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Room is decent size for NYC. Clean, quiet and updated! Bed was very comfortable, water pressure great. All of the staff was great. All in all it was a very welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Kim T
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, amazing deal through Hotwire- $89 a night! Free Wifi, free Starbucks coffee early morning, pleasant, professional and helpful staff, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: IhateNJ
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for an overnight getaway to NYC..it was perfect! Rooms are VERY clean, it is quiet and convenient to everything! Port Authority across the street--buses to connect to NJ, atlantic city, Newark airport, etc...short walk to Penn Station where you can get Crispy Creme donuts, short walk to Restaurant Row, Broadway, Times square..on Saturday and Sundays..Hells Kitchen street fair within walking distance--nice NYC getaway and worth the $127 dollars rate--plus tax approximately $147. That is is great NYC deal! But since its by Port Authority--just be cautious at night and also DVD place at top of the block..I did not feel unsafe though--just always cautious in the city.

Reviews.Title: “shopping trip to nyc”
Reviews.Author: girlfriendBoston
Reviews.Content: I just stayed with my daughter and the room was all new and the beds were fantastic. Very neat and clean-great proximity to times square. all the staff was extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. The price was fabulous for nyc-139 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Thumping music on a Wednesday night at 12:30 am”
Reviews.Author: Rawsee
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of all Starwood properties and have stayed in some nice Sheraton, Westins, St. Regis and Four Point Hotels, but have never had the music thumping so loud that I couldn't sleep. It may be just my room on the 31st floor, but it is truly making my stay here unbearable. Everything else like the bed, furnishings and bathroom.....all nice. But what good is a nice bed if you can't fall asleep in it? Won't be staying here again. There are nicer and quieter places elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tzipster
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazingly knowledgeable and accessible. They have a concierge who knows everything. His name is Eddie. The rooms are efficient and almost new. Ask for a high floor for a great view. The location is perfect, right near port authority and times square. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “First impressions are not always correct”
Reviews.Author: roopakmalik
Reviews.Content: When I first checked into the hotel at 2 at night on Feb 11 ,2012...I was not impressed at all The immediate neighbourhood is cheap and tough looking The room ,one king was small Fortunately first impressions are not always correct I asked for a double beds room....which was bigger and acceptable in size .Then I went for a stroll and found the lights of Times Square with its all night open restaurants and Duane Reades..just a block away.Both factors relieved my misgivngs The hotel is very good value for what it costs.I was in room 202 from 2/11-2/18 ,2012 and found the room comfortable,offering sound sleep and great amenities...esp the complimentary internet and the bottled water plus coffee/tea machine The little bar in the lobby and the small restaurant at back are good,reasonable and functional Beds are comfortable,housekeeping is very good and the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful Bathrroms are small but well equipped The hotel lives upto what it promises...a comfortable,clean stay without the bells and whistles I just wish the room service was open till after 11 pm...in NY 11 pm is way too early

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: torontojay
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in over 30 different hotels in Manhattan, and this was among the best. Spotlessly clean rooms and common areas, consistently pleasant staff, extremely comfortable beds and pillows, fast reliable internet access, and delicious free Starbucks coffee in the mornings made my stay at Four Points Midtown-Times Square worthy of a return visit. Despite concerns from another reviewer who visited the hotel at the same time as me, I could hear very little noise from the street or the Port Authority Bus Terminal from my 13th floor room, and by Manhattan standards, found this hotel to be very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: missmarie723
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a weekend stay at the Four Points. It's located on 40th street and 8th avenue. It's directly across from the Port Authority so don't expect a great view outside your window. The location was great we were only two blocks away from times square. We were close to everything we didn't even have to take a cab or train anywhere. The beds were amazing and add to that the blackout shades you will be fast asleep. Despite the busy location it wasn't noisy at all. The rooms are small but that's expected. The only downside is the street the hotel is on. There are some shady characters on the corner. And right next door to the hotel is the NYC parole office. We didn't have any problems walking to the hotel at night. But for some out of towners it might be a little scary.

Reviews.Title: “New York Toy Fair”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: My company booked me at this hotel for a business trip. The rooms were very small. A few people in my group said their rooms had a weird smell to them. Also rooms on the side of the building next to the Port Authority well be noisy. Buses can be heard all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Fran G
Reviews.Content: We took our trip at the end of April and it was the best trip ever. The accomodations although small for 4 people were great. Very clean. We weren't in the room much except for sleeping so it didn't matter that it was small. I loved the fact that we could leave our luggage at the front desk and they would take care of everything since our room wasn't ready. They said to go ahead and see the city. By the time we got into our room, the luggage had been put there and all in order...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Andrea63
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient and provide many options for food, entertainment and transportation. I really enjoyed the many restaurants in the vicinity-Japanese, Chinese, Italian and Cafe's. A short walk to Times Square and a short cab ride ($6.00) to Empire State Building The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. Room amenities were minimal. Check-in was quick and staff are friendly. Restaurant is quite small with few menu options (specifically breakfast). At the time I was there, it appeared that they were short staffed. Had to call housekeeping twice to ask for soap on the 2nd night (stayed for 4 nights). After a long delay, I decided to go downstairs and the front desk gave me a couple bars of soap and an apology. Overall, the experience was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great beds”
Reviews.Author: daisymae531
Reviews.Content: There IS NOT a better location to stay at in Times Square. Our first time in NYC and it was amazing, in the heart of it ALL! Walking distance to Broadway etc. Subway right outside hotel. Super comfy King size beds, very quiet, couldn't hear neighbors, traffic or anything, excellent staff, great bar, computer stations. Booked on Hotwire and got a $400 room for $179! If you want to stay in Times Square, in the heart of it all, close to EVERYTHING, Central Parl also, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: ashley c
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty small, which is typical for NY.. but they are comfortable. The hotel is on the smaller size, so it feels a little more private. The only negative thing is the location. Although it is right off of 8th ave it is across from the Port Authority and next door to the NY Parole Office.... definitely a little shady walking from the hotel to 8th ave and Times Square. I was visiting with a girlfriend and felt nervous a few times walking by some of the "Port Hookers" and people asking for money. I've stayed at hotels in this area before, and I would probably choose one of them next time instead just because of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of the Apple”
Reviews.Author: Ann A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our short trip to the NYC with a friends of mine. It was a wonderful time and a perfect location right near the Times Square. The only problem we had at first was getting to the hotel to unpack with our car, but that had to do with traffic and Friday evening :) The rooms are well furnished, although small and cozy. We had 2 king-size beds for 3 of us adults and that was perfect, but as already mentioned the beds are taking nearly all the room space. There was no breakfast included, which is not ususal for European hotels, but I found it perfectly fine for a NYC hotel, whilst we enjoyed our morning coffee in the lobby and it was wonderfully brewed. They also have ice machines which was very important for us as we were travelling by car. + the parking is in a walking distance, so we were perfectly satisfied with the hotel & I will for sure stay here again if in NYC again.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Secret in a Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: pherbert217
Reviews.Content: When I was first searching for a place for a 50 and over girlfriend's getaway weekend we were looking for the lowest price. While no NYC hotel is in any way cheap, this hotel beat out the other chain hotels in price. We booked it, and I, having lived in NYC years ago was apprehensive on where it was located and the possibility that it was a run down NYC hotel. Wow, were we surprised! The location was great! While not picturesque, it was located directly across from an entrance to Port Authority bus terminal. Therefore, there were plenty of cabs in line right around the corner. We had driven in, and it was a snap to get from the Lincoln tunnel to the parking garage near the hotel. The hotel participated with the garage so the parking was only $28.00 per nite which is half the price of normal overnite parking in NYC. We could walk anywhere and like I said before, cabs were nearby. The accommodations were very nice, even a bit upscale with luxurious bedding and decor. AND, it was not one of those horrible tiny NYC rooms. Our group consisted of 4 people and we could actually walk around the beds in the room. I have been in some NYC hotels that you just open the door and throw your bag somewhere, with no walking space. Staff was nice and courteous. I would definitely stay there again. I may even take the bus up and get off at the Port Authority since it is right across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be glad you stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: LLKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good for the money! Good location, friendly staff, nice but small rooms! The bed is oh so comfy. I will return here!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, convenient and brand spanking new.”
Reviews.Author: seekerofnewplaces
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better location. At the end of the block is an entrance to the subway- where most of the major lines pass through - easy access to everywhere in NY. The Port Authority bus terminal is right in front of the hotel yet its the not exposed but instead is a huge massive brick wall. A little bit of an eye sore but I didn't mind so much. The hotel is in walking distance to many restaurants and Broadway Theaters. Times square is 2 blocks away. Lots of shops in walking distance as well. The room was small but quaint. Bed was very comfortable. Free wireless was available however slow. The bathroom was so clean! Fresh bright white tiles. And the water pressure was good. Only downside was that there was no counter space to put a makeup bag or shaving kit. Never turned on the tv. It's NYC! Plenty to do. As a guest, you have special privilege to go to the Sky Room which is next door. No cover charge. Fantastic view of some majestic midtown skyscrapers. During warmer weather, it's open and exposed but it didn't matter that it was enclosed. Still saw great views. The staff (front desk and bellman) were friendly and professional and the Concierge easily arranged transportation to the airport for us. The hotel served its purpose. We were out and about most of the time we were in NY but were happy to come back to our room which was serviced and cleaned and quiet. Overall: great time! Definitely recommended for the cost and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel awesome value”
Reviews.Author: BobW79
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the times square area of new York. It was a short three block walk to times square and the theater district. Paid extra for a " city view" room but it wasn't worth it. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday was Fabulous, Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jake D
Reviews.Content: Went to NY for my 40th Birthday, and Marco the manager upgraded our room, left balloons, and champagne for my visit. The service was excellent, the staff was overtly kind and helpful, and the location was maybe a few blocks away from Times Square but perfectly situated a block from all the Subways and prime locations I wanted to visit. I would stay here again and LOVED IT!!!! Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jo0308
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, very cheap compared to others situated nearby. Its in a great location, only a few blocks from Times Square. The room was always very clean and quite spacious too. The staff seemed very nice and always willing to help. The bar is very small, tiny in fact. Its in the lobby opposite the checking in desks. There're only 3 or 4 tables. You can use the roof top terrace bar at the hotel next door. You have to check your coat in so don't bother taking one with you if you do go.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points by Sheraton Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Julia L
Reviews.Content: Conveniently situated, clean and comfortable, but with a couple of dissapointments. There was no WiFi in this hotel, and the buffet breakfast advertised, is only at the weekends during the winter months. Not a problem in NYC, however, because you are surrounded by numerous restaurants of all ethnicities. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parking at the Port Authority??”
Reviews.Author: Frostoria
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton Midtown - Times Square is right around the corner from the Port Authority and handy to the Theater District. We were promptly greeted by a friendly staff. The room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Our request for a room on an upper floor was granted...so, we had a great view. An exceptionally good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.....nice staff....clean room”
Reviews.Author: Vivaladiva1
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't in the greatest location, but I stayed here because I had an early norning meeting a few blocks away and its walking distance from Penn Station. Free drink coupon for SPG Platinum members. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I didn't hear any noise in my room. I didn't have a decent view, but maybe next time. My room was clean, decent size (for Times Square area) Robes and slippers are comfy. The internet was out for an ENTIRE day which messed me up pretty bad. The area has many starbucks and cafes but are packed with tourist, so I ended up at another hotel lobby and used their wifi. Four Points internet is free to all guest so you get what you pay for :( I will stay here again if I have to work in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Comfortable & Great location!”
Reviews.Author: singaporesling49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel January 13 - 16, 2012. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Room size is small but actually bigger than other rooms I have stayed at in NYC. We were on the 8th floor and there was no street noise at night. Location was excellent being only a short walk (5 blocks, 5 minutes) to Times Square. At night it felt safe to walk around and there were quite a few nice lounges/pubs/ restaurants nearby on 9th ave. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Mikecoss
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Preferred guest and so i decidede to stay at the 4 points by Sheraton hotel Times Square when i was in new york this last week. i would say it is average at best. no porters to meet you with your bags and the rooms were pretty small. The name is also quite deceptive as it is not really on times square at all, rather it is a bit of a walk and in new york winter this is not really feasable........the rooms were neat but average.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: vicki_d2009
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location. Clean and nice staff. The maid even left us a 'thank you' note for the tip we left! Yes it is near a parole office and an adult DVD shop, however, this did not affect our experience at all. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Points Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2154
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT VALUE! Great location yet not full of the tourist crowd. Walk everywhere. Free coffee service & great gym. The most comfortable mattress I've experienced in any hotel. Concierge service. I would highly recommend and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, and Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: deb_seethesights
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel in early January 2012. Location: The location was excellent. It was a short walk to Times Square, the Theaters, 5th Avenue, and many restaurants. It is far enough from Times Square that it is less hectic and less noisy. What made this hotel excellent was that it was very quiet. We stayed on the 7th floor and found it one of the quietest hotels we have stayed at. Each floor only has approx. 8 rooms on it, so this helps. Food: Breakfast was included in our deal and we found it to be decent. It wasn't a huge buffet, but it had scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, pastries, bagels, pancakes or french toast, and fruit salad. Coffee, Tea and Juice was also provided. Parking: Parking was $28 a two minute walk down the street - very convenient. Service: The front desk staff was very helpful - meeting our request to have our group in side by side rooms and to be put in a room away from the elevators. Having a business centre (with free printing) and a decent gym were very convenient and nice perks. Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel again. The value was excellent! The location and service were great!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichandCarmen
Reviews.Content: Wow this hotel is awesome. Its right across the road from the Port Authority which links all the trains and busses. Its only a short 10 min walk to the centre of times square which is a great lively place to visit and even in the off peak season its packed. We stayed at this hotel twice firstly for 5 nights then did a tour and stayed there again for 2 nights. The hotel staff were friendly and the room is just lovely not to small and in very good condition. Will stay again when I head to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Cody A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points over Christmas while on our honeymoon. Very easy to get around by foot but also half a block away from a taxi rank, so getting around isn't a problem. The good: - Staff were helpful. Especially, the concierge(s) who helped us find tickets to The Book of Mormon without spending more than $300 a pop. - Location is wonderful. Very close to Times Square. - Room was clean and bigger than we were expecting. The bad: - We found the wifi in the rooms to be very slow. Not sure if that's to do with being so high up (and maybe far away from the router), but there was a significant difference between the ethernet and wifi. In fact, the wifi was so slow it was unbearable so we bought an ethernet adapter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Webhol83
Reviews.Content: Booked through another web site this hotel was well worth the price we paid. Arrived at 2pm and was greeted by reception staff and immediately checked in from this point on this member of staff always greeted me by name. The rooms are small but well laid out the king bed was super comfy and room had a large tv! The heating was good. Maids came everyday pretty early but there was a later please sign to hang on door. 8th avenue was the perfect location 42 street subway entrance down street towards 8th was brilliant we got a week long pass for $30. Try shake shack on 8th ave for a good burger but don't expect to sit or be comfy it's crowded! Check out was easy the extended the check our by an hour and stored our bags they also booked us a town car for return to JFK. Bags are stored in reception and a room behind as lobby is small but trusted them with my stuff. The concierge will help you book tickets etc! Honestly the staff here are great! A lovely hotel I d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tes
Reviews.Content: Great Location, friendly staff? Not the best hotel we have stayed in but completely adequate, for everything else. Will probably return

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TrevsLaLa
Reviews.Content: Good central location. We stayed here for five nights and walked everywhere. Lobby is pretty small, but the staff is friendly and helpful. Room was really clean and the bed was very comfortable. Room was little small, but not really bad. How much room do you really need anyway? We never had any reservations about walking to/from the hotel at any time of the day or night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: tobytyler123
Reviews.Content: Got this via the PL Negotiator. Not bad at all. If you want to really do a NYC trip, I highly recommend the triad of this hotel, MoMA and Le Bernardin for a pricy but amazing lunch, with all POIs being within a block-ish of eachother. Also took the subway directly over to Momofuku and a show. The location made everything super convenient. The hotel itself: elevators are fast, which makes my ears pop but is otherwise great. Rooms are reasonably spacious, and cosmetically upgraded. Beds and in-room coffee are standard Sheraton, and pretty dang good. Coffee creamer is sadly powdered but a fridge is available if you care to store your own. Big downer: no tags to hang on your door to say "Please don't disturb" which means you get disturbed 3-4x each morning. Big plus: location, of course depending on what you want to do, and their participation in online bidding sites is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CynNTon
Reviews.Content: We have to admit we were hesitant about staying here, as some of the reviews mentioned the thing about being right next door to the Parole office and two sex shops. Well those reviews are just opinions and we all know everyone has one. We arrived on the 23rd around 12 and were able to check in right away, not only that we had been upgraded to a city view king room!!! Yes the room was small, but from what I understand it is bigger than most other area hotels and we made it work just fine. All rooms in NYC are apparently small, (you're not going to NYC to sleep folks) The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean, we had no problems whatsoever. In fact Sandy and Keith and a few others we had the pleasure of dealing with were exceptional. We were pretty weary on the day of checkout, they held our bags for us so we could finish up our last day, **(they must be able to close) but we still had some shopping bags they just couldnt take. Sandy felt so badly about it that she offered us a glass of wine before we left. Another gentleman offered to call a car service for us, because we were having difficulty getting a hold of the same one that got us there (cabs would have been about the same rate as it was rush hour) Overall its a great place, good location, about 2 short blocks to Times Square. *We recommend getting a map of the city from AAA or something before you go, as they are not cheap once you get there. We would definitley recommend/stay at this hotel. Also good to note, although we did not dine at the restaurant, it did have an A sanitary rating, which is good to know when looking for places to eat in the City. Dont settle for anything less than an A rating. Also DONT go to the Carnigie Deli, it is a tourist trap rip off and so not worth $25 for a sandwich, even if it could feed 3-4ppl So the moral of this review, dont be afraid to book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: reachteresa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. There was nothing really great or really bad about it. It was clean, in a decent location, and that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are too small for families”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. I reserved two rooms hoping for adjoining rooms. The hotel does not have any rooms that connect. The rooms (even by NY) standards are way too small. With luggage, and a stroller, we were having a difficult time just walking around the room. This is a new hotel so the rooms and common areas are very clean. If you are a business man looking for a clean place to stay then I recommend this hotel. If you are a family, then I would not recommend this hotel. Apart from the rooms being small, the location isn't that great. you are technically a block and a half from Time Square, but that half block seems a bit too "sketchy." Again, a business man by himself, not a problem. Walking around with the kids, I didn't feel that comfortable, especially at night. The staff were okay. They were friendly and accommodating. The check-in process could be better as it seemed like there was only one person checking in guests.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “We went to book in only to find our booking agent had booked on the wrong month in the wrong name”
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: We were put in the hotel 3 doors away. We moved into the 4 points the next days. The hotel couldnot do enough to make our stay great. The room was very clean and really comfortable. The staff were friendly. It is central for everything Time Square being 5 mons away . There are plenty of restaurants and hops in the area too. So thanks to all the staff and a happy holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: PA-Family-of-five
Reviews.Content: Nice room, friendly service and inexpensive parking...what more can you ask for in the Big City!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Danny M
Reviews.Content: Great rooms-- great beds--- great showers--great service and hospitality-- small lobby--not much space down in the lobby if you have a large group to meet with, but if you are traveling as a family, or small group...great place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff, OK location”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, reasonably priced hotel - it's clean, fairly modern, and has comfortable beds. The staff makes this place as they are very friendly and willing to accomodate. Location is ok, it's near Times Square but next to the Port Authority Bus Station - great for catching cabs as there is a cab line just around the corner, but somewhat sketchy. There is a small bar in the lobby and a fitness center. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Azuredirection
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC for our honeymoon. We choose this hotel because of a special rate offer we received from our reward points. Our honeymoon was a long weekend so we were able to observe the hotel both weekday and weekend. Positives: Great Value (for the Times Square area and with our special), the higher floors (which we had) offer decent views of the city, some of the employees really go above and beyond to ensure their guest have an enjoyable stay, and by NYC standards the room is a decent size (King Beds, which is hard to come by in the city). You can open your windows and listen to the city, they have black-out shades for those who like to sleep in, and Showtime. You're blocks from most of NYC's entertainment: Broadway, Rockafeller Center, Times Square, Toys-r-us, Macy's, 5th Ave, etc. 95% of our stay was very accommodating and pleasant. Not-so-Positive: The low-point of our trip was unfortunately the ending. Having stayed there for four days, we asked the bell-hop desk to assist us in hailing a taxi a number of times. It can be very difficult obtaining a taxi, especially in Times Square during the weekend. It's almost a competitive sport for us non-natives. Most of the bellmen were helpful and accommodating except for ALEX. In hopes of making it easier for the staff, we called down from our room, requesting that a cab be hailed for us. Alex, the bellman, responded that he didn't provide this service. Puzzled, and overwhelmed with the idea of having to lug our suitcases and shopping bags along 40th street to find a cab ourselves, we went down to the lobby, hoping there was a misunderstanding. I went to the bell-stand, and Alex was there. I repeated my request and he responded that they don't flag cabs for guests. I stood there confused because every other bell-person had done this for us, so I didn't understand why this was an issue now. Surprisingly, this wasn't the depth of Alex's unprofessional tact, because as he brushed me aside and began checking the bags of other guests, he asked one of the ladies if they would need help acquiring a taxi cab or car service later in the day!!! My husband and I were floored and utterly insulted! I was not rude; we were floating down from the bliss of an amazing honeymoon - why was he treating us this way? Obviously this was selective service; so I asked for a manager. I shared our concerns with Marcus, the manager on duty, explaining that we were in a hurry to catch our train. He addressed Alex, who by this time was outside hailing a taxi. As were were being escorted to it by the manager, who was very apologetic, Alex was stomping back inside, refusing to open the taxi door or settle our luggage in the taxi for us. What a horrible send off! Definitely not indicative of the $1000+ we spent with the hotel during our stay. With unemployment being so high, it's such a shame to see individuals take their jobs for granted. Outside of that, there were only minor things: the room was a bit dusty, there was a ring around our sink, and the room service leaves much to be desired. Also, the front desk was aware of our honeymoon, and I believe they assigned us a city view room because of that (and that was beautiful), but nothing above that was offered (i.e. a congratulatory comment at check-in, complimentary champagne toast, a desert or fruit tray, not even a congrats card) However, there are hundreds of restaurants surrounding the hotel, the room service is NOT good, but it's not offensive, and 99% of the staff was amazing. Overall, it's a good place to stay, but not great. For Times Square, the rate was just about equal to the quality - but in all fairness, our experience with Alex really brought our perception about this hotel down. We probably won't opt to stay here when we visit again in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms, Overall Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ravi_trivedi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place in Nov, and had a overall good experience. From my perspective here are the positives and negatives of the place Positives 1) Great Location. Right next to Times Square, and close to Penn Station. 2) Comfortable, and Clean Room. 3) Had a promo offer of free breakfast, which was OK quality. If I were to pay for it, and/or compare it to other properties, I would rate it average (or slightly below). 4) Most of the staff was helpful. Negatives 1) Rooms were smaller (typical of NY). 2) Had a slightly negative experience with an associate, who wasnt ready to honor the promotion I had taken, since she wasnt aware of it. Had to explain the stuff in detail to her, and even then got partial benefit. Overall, I would recommend the place due to solid location

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: shida_girlBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during one of the busiest weekends in the winter - the first weekend in December. I can't speak on the price because I used Starwood points but the hotel was decent and the online pricing for the same weekend there were much cheaper than others in the area. I typically always stay at the Westin Times Square but I was not expecting the same level of sophistication and service at a 4 Points. It is a lower, more budget-friendly hotel and that is what I was expecting. Check-in was easy: lobby is very small but efficient and we were checked in within 5 minutes. Very friendly staff and they were very helpful in getting us in comfortably and quickly. We were placed on the 23rd floor (room 2306). I think that the floor is for Starwood Preferred Members (as the sign indicated when you got off the elevator) but the room was very well appointed, much nicer than I anticipated. The location is not super ideal - just far enough from the theaters to think about it - but decent considering the hotels right in the Square were going for $600 and up for the same weekend. It was not that big of a deal being a few blocks off Times Square. We ate at the Gotham Bistro in the hotel for breakfast (check restaurant.com - they have gift certificates for the location) and the food was decent, not great. Two of the employees at the restaurant got into a little argument which caused a little bit of commotion but the staff recovered quickly and got us our order fairly efficiently. Concierge was very helpful as well. All in all, better than expected service from a modestly priced hotel in a fairly convenient area. In NYC, that is saying alot!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SueGPeacehaven
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a shopping trip to NY.The hotel was comfortable and very clean. Staff were helpful. It is a very good location for shopping and for Times square. The bus station is just across the road if you are traveling to the outlet shopping malls. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Harriett R
Reviews.Content: In the 300 block of West 42nd, the hotel is right next door to the New York State Board of Parole. The parolees are coming & going!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Major Attractions”
Reviews.Author: captaincomment
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short trip to NYC to watch the Macy's Thanksgiving Parade. Staff was very helpful and friendly. We arrived on Tuesday am after a red eye flight. Got to the hotel at about 8am hoping to just drop our bags off. Instead, they had a room ready for us so we were able to check in. Its across from the Bus depot so the subway stop there is a major one that allows for a lot of options. Some previous comments talk about it being next to the Parole Building. We found this to be no problem as we walked back to hotel all hours of day. If anything there is a line outside the building around 7:30 till it opens at around 8am. Also, avoid going up to 9th ave. The room was adequate size and we had a view of the Empire State Building. Cleaning staff jumps right on cleaning the room early so by the time we went to the room for a "pit stop" it had been cleaned. No complaints and no cons with the room or hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Starwood after this Four Points.”
Reviews.Author: DarkTryst201
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 605 for the Thanksgiving weekend. 1) The TV was not working, could NOT even find the outlet to figure why pressing the button on the remote and TV wasn't working... 2) The outlet in the bathroom did NOT work... 3) the outlets under the TV, only two of three worked... 4) The room faced some shop and the noise across was louder than the heater... 5)The strings to the blinds were broken so the sheer stayed closed, however, the privacy/light blocking blind wasn't rolling down... 6) For a Starwood, there was no parking, nearest was a garage two blocks away, and you pass two sex shops before getting to the hotel... Just really disappointed in this hotel and its location; shames the other Starwood hotels...

Reviews.Title: “A surprising bargain in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Alan17584
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. Very convenient location, helpful staff, very comfy and accommodating restaurant. The lobby and check in area are very small but the rooms were a nice size. Our room was clean and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: allyphant
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Four Points after a 24 hours long flights and 1 hour shuttle ride in from the airport at around 11.45 am on a Wednesday morning. I was really looking forward to a shower but was disappointed to learn that the hotel's computer systems were down and they were unable to let me do an early check in (it didn't matter if I was a SPG member or not). All I needed was a quick shower and I was prepared to leave my bags at the hotel and come back later on to check in. I wasn't told if there was full occupancy or not, but it seemed like they could not provide me with a solution till 3pm. It was a good thing another friend of mine checked in at a nearby hotel and I took a shower at her place. As for the stay itself, the bed was comfortable, the rooms were clean and were a good size. Honestly, it was quite a comfortable and pleasant stay all round save for the initial impression. As for the location, it is centrally located near Times Square but personally I find it a tad West (between 8th and 9th Ave) for my liking. It gets quieter and more desserted walking towards the hotel, I mean Times Square is still in full view as you walk there but I just don't quite fancy the feeling of it getting quieter and darker. I'll accept that I'm just more particular that way and objectively, it is still considered to be well located. The subway is nearby and you're just a stone's throw away from lots of food and entertainemnt joints including Dean and Delucas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Clean, Clean”
Reviews.Author: skiwithapro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on West 40 th st between 8th and 9th across from the Port Authority. Not convient if you drive your own car, but what is in New York. Close to Times Square and 42 St, it's a great location for Mid-Town activities. But what struck me most about this hotel was how clean it was. Even in the elevator I felt like I was in an operating room. The room and bath were above the standard hotel issue. I was more than pleased. Restaurant in the hotel, but it's New York, walk out the front door and there are restaurants all over the place. The service from the staff was exceptional, they couldn't have been more helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: VacationCrazy47
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Four Points. The check in process was easy, quick and perfect, and the people working to check us in were polite and professional. The room was small, but it had absolutely everything we needed. It was very clean and up to date as well. The bed was quite warm and comfy. The hotel is situated near all the great spots in Midtown Manhattan; we only had to walk from 8th over to 7th to be in the middle of all the action. Great stay for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “solid place, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Toni-Lynn M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, convenient, and most of the staff extremely friendly. The room was fantastic and the bed was very comfortable. My husband loved the large shower. We walked everywhere we needed to get to because of the fantastic location. The view wasn't bad. Loved the complimentary beverages in the morning, and the restaraunt was small but comfy. We only ate breakfast there but it was very good, reasonably priced, and was well portioned. Didn't l;ike having to go down to the lower level for ice and soda. There was one bottle of complimentary water inthe room. No store or place to buy amenities, but we didn't need any so I don't know if the hotel offerred anything. We got there early on our checkin day and checked our bags, which included an open shopping bag with a gift we had just purchased. When we checked out we needed to also check our bags as we had a full day of activities before leaving - the clerk would not check the open bag!! so we had to lug the bag around all day. We were not happy. Next to the hotel are 2 more hotels to the west and to the east a parking area, a liquor store, a chinese food place, and 2 'adult' stores. I was not very comfortable walking down that street as there was often people loitering. We usually crossed the street then walked down. the Port Authority if directly across the street - very convenient if that is how you are getting in and out of the city. We walked from grand central. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mehtap3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there a couple nights before thanksgiving. It was business/pleasure trip to NYC. I used to live in NYC before and I am very familiar with the subway system, I picked a location close to Times Square/ Port Authority subway station so it would be most convenient for me to travel for my work around the city. There is a parking garage right next door which is offers space at a discounted rate for guests of the hotel, its expensive but its still cheaper than other NYC rates. We had reward points from SPG so we used those, but the check in was hassle free, the staff extremely helpful and friendly and we loved our stay there. Will definitely still there again.

Reviews.Title: “great times off times square”
Reviews.Author: leftyj1001
Reviews.Content: Last weekend my daughter and I had show tickets for Friday evening, and reservations at this location- everything went perfectlyfrom the moment we stepped off the train at Penn Station , to our return there 26 hours later. The hotel was within walking distance to not only the train, but most theaters, restaurants, 5th Avenue(where the windows are awesome this time of year) , tkts, and Central Park, which we enjoyed strolling due to the nice weather.Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful, and the accomodations were excellent. I would certainly tell others to visit and stay because, for such a hustle-bustle place, Sheraton Midtown Times Square keeps it real!

Reviews.Title: “a possible bargain”
Reviews.Author: pfdk
Reviews.Content: I wish every hotels web site would have a price list like this hotel. When making a reservation you get a lot of choices og price. Read the terms carefully and you might get a bargain. Hotel location is close to the airport express bus stop at 42th (arriving) and 41th (departing). Standing in front of the hotel, it looks like a tourist class hotel. It is not. The ground floor is not very inviting with a small reception, a very small bar and a Bistro hidden in the back, behind the reception. However the staff in the reception is very helpfull, the bar has a good assortment and the bartender is very good and the Bistro serve very good food at resonable price. This is very important since there is very few restaurants in the area unless you just want a quick bite, then you have a maximum of 100 meters between the joints. The rooms is spacious with a good view and with every amenity you might need. Officially the hotel has a 3 star rating (tourist class). I will not hasitate but give this hotel a 4 star rating (first calss).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location matched by excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travelador
Reviews.Content: On my second stay at this hotel - that I chose because of the fantastic location, just off 8th Ave and across from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, I was impressed by the helpfulness and responsiveness of the staff. Yes, the lobby is a little small and busy, the bar tucked in a small corner, but most of these skinny high-rise hotels in NYC are just the same. The room amenities were good and the 4 points offers free water and wifi at a very decent price. This hotel is on my short list of NYC hotels now.

Reviews.Title: “A big Sheraton disappointment! Not like an SPG Property at all!”
Reviews.Author: LIbbewdc
Reviews.Content: This is the only the second disappointment in a dozen years with Starwoods Properties/ Simon Property Group hotels, and I truly hope this particular Sheraton gets its act together! The location is very convenient to Times Square and the rack rate 30-50% of what the Westin and W charge, so we really wanted to make this work. The location by the Port Authority, Parole Center, and the Adult DVD Rental and Viewing Booth store were even not a problem for us as we were not travelling with children. Once inside, the night desk staff was not particularly hospitable. She indicated she had upgraded the room to the Platinum floor, and there was a settee, etc. for our 5 day stay. Sounded great, but what a disappointment. We could barely move around. We are not NYC newbies, and understand that the rooms are small, but this room, including bathroom and entry hallway was probably more like 22 x 12 feet, with the length of the king bed, a work chair and desk filling the 12 feet! We literally had to move the chair to get from the window side of the bed to the restroom. The calamaties continued with no robes, no slippers, no air conditioning, dripping shower, broken ink pens and finally either noseeum gnats or bedbugs, we couldn't determine which. The day staff, concierge and housekeeping staff were quite pleasant and did what they could to make the stay enjoyable. Discounted meals and laundry, etc, were all very nice and appreciated, but at the end of the day, we needed a more spacious, clean, comfortable, bug free, air conditioned room to sleep and work. And the owner of this particular property was not able to deliver that during our visit. We travel to NY frequently and despite the convenience to Times Square, we will use our Platinum SPG status elsewhere where it is meaningful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LVJ1980
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for a deal on Hotwire (a travel bidding site) and I was very pleased with the location. I took the Bolt Bus up to NY and it was an easy 12-15 block walk to the hotel. The lobby of the hotel is a bit small and dark and you have to go around the corner to reach the elevators. There is a dining room back there but I never ate in it. There's also one computer there with a printer. I had my netbook with me so I only used it once to look something up when I was heading out the door. I don't know if there are more computers somewhere and if there is a bigger business area. My room was clean and comfortable. I had a large queen bed. The bathroom was nice and clean. The toiletries were a little cheap (very watery lotion). The only thing (which may partly be my fault) I called for a robe and some other toiletries but never received them. Truthfully, I stepped out of the room to grab a soda from the vending machine for a few minutes and then maybe 1 hour later went out for the evening so it's possible that I missed the maid but it would have been nice if they left a note saying they were there or even left the stuff in my room. Another thing, for a hotel in Midtown/Times Square, I was surprised and happy that I didn't hear a lot of noise from outside. I couldn't afford this hotel on my own if I didn't get a good deal on it but I'd recommend other to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, polite staff just too bad we encounter some technical issues”
Reviews.Author: SteveLSK
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Its 4 mins walk to time square, 1 mins walk to Port Authority and subway. Staff were mostly polite but we were having some issues with our booking. Luckily I had proof of my booking on hardcopy. Basic room with tight space and and comfortable bed but very expensive during autumn peak period. Very bad WIFI reception in the corner room. Another incidence, was bump out of my booking as one of the tour group staying at the hotel need to extend their stay due to flight issue when I re-checkin after my Niagara fall trip but hotel book me into fairfiield next door. The only thing is I had booked for a city view but was given a carpark view instead.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mollymach
Reviews.Content: Close to the action of Times Square without the noise and traffic right outside your window. The staff treat you like family. Great attitude and always looking to ensure your full satisfaction. Lisa at the lobby bar is the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “It's NYC on a budget, it does it's job.”
Reviews.Author: SimplyJax
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC and stayed at the Four Points Sheraton on W 40th st. Now this was my 3rd time in NYC having previously stayed at the Marriott right on Times Square and the Sheraton Midtown on 7th and 52nd and well, this hotel is basically somewhere to leave your bags and sleep. Nothing special, nothing great but nothing bad either. The front desk staff at all times were really nice and helpful. The location served our purpose as it is right across the Port Authority from where we took a shuttle to the IZOD center for a concert. It is right next to the garment district so for shopping it was great. The NYC parole board office next door was not an issue and the peep show next door too, well if we didn't have one it just wouldn't be New York. The front lobby is super small, no entertainment because there is no room. The rooms are much smaller than I stayed at in the other hotels I mentioned, but not unusual for NYC is my understanding. I was worried about the bed bugs mentioned in earlier reviews, but did not have any issue with that either. The noise factor, we were on the 31st floor, so heard just a little and the music from the night club next door, well again didn't bother us. In a nut shell, this hotel is a no frills, moderate place to lay your head and leave your bags. If you're not expecting a Sex and the city, 5th ave, The W hotel, experience, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Large, comfortable rooms; great location”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel located just next to Port Authority Bus Terminal on 40th and 8th. Really convenient to subway, Broadway theaters, lots of restaurants. Rooms are huge by NYC standards. Beds and beddings are incredibly comfortable. Lobby is small but functional. I got a nice rate from Hotwire too! Big thumbs up for the Four Points by Sheraton Midtown. I'll be a repeat guest when the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Good location , horrible concierge”
Reviews.Author: nizora
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights in October. Not our first choice of hotel, but others were fully booked , this was the best we could get in our budget range of $300 . The room was small , but clean and the bed was comfortable. We were hardly in the room , so the size was no issue for us. Initially , upon reading the TA members' reviews ,we were very concerned about the surrounding of the hotel, but it turned out fine.The location is not in the best street of New York ,but we did not feel threaten in any way going in and out of the hotel day or night. The plus side is , it is only about 5 minutes walk to Times square. In general we found the staff were friendly and helpful, but ONE " the concierge " , was he not only so bloody arrogant, also stupidly did not have a slightest clue why he was there for -- to serve the hotel guests. If he was not willing to serve, obviously he was in a wrong industry , HOSPITALITY. If ever we go back to New York, would we stay at this hotel again ? Very likely not..Too many better hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Overall”
Reviews.Author: Dre024
Reviews.Content: The location was very close to Times Square. The bed was amazing, felt like I was sleeping on a pillow. Everything was clean, very friendly staff, we were happy overall!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing to brag about”
Reviews.Author: joujoukim
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, clean, friendly staff but walking into the lobby is like walking into NY Penn Station. There are clusters of crowds all over the place and you need to practically part the seas to get to the check-in desk. There has to be a better way to get people in, out and out of the way of pedestrian traffic. The lounge is extremely dark and prices for drinks and light bites ridiculous, even for NY standards. Location wise, this place is within blocks from some great restaurants and fun, interesting bars.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: jannaweber
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to do a very quick trip to NYC. We literally were only in New York for 36 hours. This hotel was perfect for our needs. The room was small but that was probably because of the king size bed. And still probably wasn't a small room for NYC. It a great location, close to everything. We didn't spend much time at the hotel but when we were there everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - one issue.”
Reviews.Author: Seren96
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. We were just a short distance to Times Square. The hotel itself is typical NY. Everything seems so crammed but our room was decent. We had an amazingly comfortable bed. I slept like a baby. Loved that they brought us water everyday as we needed it being there in JULY !! Bathroom is extremely small with no counter space but its doable. the only downside is -----drumroll ---- we had bed bug bites :( we didnt realize it until we left. We thought we had been bit out at Central park since we were out there all day for about 4 days but we came to realize it wasnt. If they could get rid of the bed bugs i'd definitely wanna stay there again. My husband had alot and they were UGLY !! Anyhow, We were here on a budget so we loved picking up a slice of pizza from the little corner place "3 brothers" for like $2 ! Walked over to Dallas BBQ for lunch for about $6-7 a person and the food was delicious. It was a bit busy but still good bbq. Walked to a broadway show, caught the subway just a hop skip n jump away from our hotel. Cant beat it ! oh and last but not least went to a Yankee game !!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lucky N
Reviews.Content: Our company stayed at this hotel during a recent convention. I initially had a poor perception of Four Points in general but this particular hotel has changed that. The location was great for our purposes - it was only a 15 minute walk to Javits Convention Center. The decor was above average, the facilities clean, and the staff were very helpful and accommodating. The rooms were on the small side but everything seemed new and the beds were very comfortable. (Cons) -The wi-fi is spotty at best, but this seems to be very common in most NY hotels. -btw - When you ask the bellman to book car service for you, make sure you confirm the rate with both the bellman and the driver in attendance. The bellman told me one thing and the driver told me another. It was only a $5 difference, but I didn't appreciate the inconsistency.

Reviews.Title: “Energy of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Merle M
Reviews.Content: Thanks to our Starwood points that we lovingly saved for our trip to NYC we had a great time and enjoyed many highlights. A restaurant in the Village "Left Bank" was awesome and "Becco" on 46th real good food and great value. Brunch at Bryant Park Grill in the winter garden also a delight! Walk the High Line from 14th to 30th and came back for a snack in the restaurant in the Hotel. The only complaint is there could be more hooks in the bathroom for robes and towels. As our flight home was late the Hotel gave us a later check out time..Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “great times square hotel”
Reviews.Author: Howard_Yao
Reviews.Content: perfect location to reach out to nearly all nyc spots via walking or metro. rooftop bar is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mblevine
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton property, although listed as "Times Square" is a few blocks North on Avenue at 53rd, but still within easy walking distance of Times Square proper. The facility is undergoing remodeling and renovation. The room in which I stayed was one that was recently renovated and upgraded, but small. Although not large, the rooms have all the amenities you'd expect and is very well laid out. The bathroom is also small but, again, is well laid out. No towel bars in the bathroom, but the usual reminder that to save water, etc., hang your towels on the towel bar for reuse. Oh well. The exercise facility is quite nice and well-equipped. WiFi and Internet are plentiful and easily available to all guests, but "Sheraton Link" in the lobby area could use more computers. WiFi is free in the lobby area and in parts of the facility, but strangely costs $14.95/day when used from the guestroom. More and more hotels have free WiFi throughout their buildings and, more and more, free WiFi is becoming ubiquitous. There's even free WiFi in Times Square! Guests can upgrade their rooms and gain access to the Club/Lounge on the 44th floor for a relatively modest charge of $50/day. If you're a Starlight Preferred Platinum cardholder, I believe Club access is included. There are additional computers in the Club area. The Club also serves a modest breakfast and snacks beginning at 5:30. Food is plentiful and adequate. Soft drinks are complimentary, but there's a charge for alcohol. All in all, a great place to stay. Hotel staff are friendly and courteous - and in the lobby area they are abundant, with the possible exception of reception staff. At 7 one morning, there seemed to be only one person on duty, and there was a short backup waiting for service. Since I got a terrific rate by booking through Priceline (about 1/2 the normal rate), there are no complaints whatsoever. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Donna P
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time we had! The staff at Four Points by Sheraton Midtown-Time Square is the best group of individuals. Sandy, in particular is a gem! She is so personable and warm, with a great personality. Everyone we came in contact with made sure that we were comfortable and satisfied. We were constantly asked if everything was to our satifaction. My next stay in New York will be at this location. Thank you all Donna P.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: aitchjbee1154
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on first visit to New York. Recommended for location. Easy to walk to Times Square and subway. Area poorly lit at night. Rooms small but clean. Bed although comfortable soft in the middle. Front desk staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bugfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. The location of the hotel is good to walk to Times Square however I would be mindful at night as it is across from the Port Authority and on the same block as the NY Parole Board, which was unsettling. The staff was helpful and good at their jobs, check in was efficient. The lobby is quite small and despite the location of this hotel and that it is in a city, a room key is not required to use the elevator as I would have expected and is standard in similar hotels I have stayed at in Manhattan. The room was clean but quite small as was the bathroom. It was adequate for just one person for one night. I would not suggest this room for more than one person or for a much longer stay. Overall I would stay here again if I had to, but as a female travelling alone, I would prefer to stay at a hotel that is not a block off a main road and by the parole board. I do not feel that the cost of over $300 per night was worth it. I have stayed at other properties in Manhattan for the same or less which had much larger rooms and more ammenities. This is a fine hotel, however I feel that for the price, you can find a better location and one with larger rooms but its not a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A fairly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BM W
Reviews.Content: Everything with the hotel is pretty good- front desk are helpful with lots of information, impressive food from the restaurant Gotham Bistro is very good, especially breakfast, salad very fresh. Rooms are OK though it is very small. The only issue with me is the room always has noise (maybe due to aircondition machine running outside) from outside all day and night, hard to fall sleep. Next time I may look for a startwood hotels which have a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Short Trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: Jill2903
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a short trip to NYC. The room was a reasonable size for New York, the bathroom was very small but room enough to do what was necessary. The bed and pillows were so comfortable, wish I could have got them in my case to bring home!! The street where the hotel is located is not one of the best in the city and I would not be happy walking back late at night on my own or with my daughter, but it is very close to Times Square and some of the main sights. A subway station is only a matter of minutes away by foot. Although some of the staff were very helpful this was outweighed by the ones who were not, particularly on the information desk. We had a great time visiting the city but would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring some of the main sights in Manhattan. Close to the theartre district which was great for us as we had reservations to see Spiderman. The room was small but thats what you expect in NYC. I did find the bed uncomfortable. It seemed to collapse in the middle. We found some of the staff to be very helpful while others were the total opposite. There is a bus terminal opposite the hotel so can be quite noisy. Also there are a few questionalble adult shops on the street which bring down the area somewhat. You are paying for the location for this hotel so overall not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Tattooed-oik
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, great location re close to times sq and broadway, good central starting point to tour the city and easy to find your way home. one of two downers for me was it was so easy to find our way back as it is opposite the bus terminal, our view was buses turning round, also it is next door to the probation office so getting to times square mid morning was a bit of a head down and hustle as the sidewalk was full of hood rats waiting to see their PO! get past those two bits and as a place to lay your head it is great, memory foam mattress was awesome, best nights sleep ever, helpful staff, very helpful concierge, cant comment on the food - does anyone eat in the hotel in NY really????? for the price and location worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Room Sizes”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie T
Reviews.Content: We had been traveling for 10 days prior to arriving in NYC. I was warned about room sizes in New York City. Upon opening the door to our room, I was very pleasantly surprised. There was plenty of room for the two of us (my girlfriend and I) with two double beds. The bathroom was not cramped. There was room for all of our clothes (for 4 days), and the beds were so great that my girlfriend is ordering one like it for her home.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: Danp36
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something extra nice in the Times Square area that would give easy access to the whole city. When we first checked in, they gave us a small room by accident. They immediately changed it to the suite we'd reserved and threw in free drinks and free breakfast to compensate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: YolandeL
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location for a holiday trip. I enjoyed a girls' weekend here. The front desk staff were quite friendly and we were able to get all the tourist information [maps, tours etc] at a moment's notice. The room was clean and comfortable. We got it on special as we booked well in advance. Do not expect a breathtaking view as there are high rise buildings all around but you cannot beat it for location. It is one street away from a subway also for those who wish to take longer trips. I would definitely recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed!”
Reviews.Author: Debsadventures
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The bed was huge and took up most of the room. Plasma tv, room safe, very very clean, comfortable. Room service fantastic. Restaurant food great, especially the chocolate muffins for breakfast. Staff very helpful and polite. Positioned right in Times Square but no noise to be heard from my room. Would most definately recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good beds”
Reviews.Author: okedem
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, immediately adjacent to a Fairfield Inn (and the rooms are almost identical). The location is good - a few blocks from Times Square, very close to a subway station. The street looks a bit run-down, but okay. The room was small, but still fine. The bed was very comfortable. All in all - a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for Midtown stay”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_Los_Altos_CA
Reviews.Content: Great location only a couple blocks from Time Square, and well priced for that location. Rooms are updated, comfortable, and above all clean. I read earlier posts about bedbug problem, but encountered none.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Eleanorrob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good area. Rooms were lovely and the bed was to die for. Only complaint left ipod in hotel safe but they did not find it!

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommended! Five stars all round.”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel so much we ended up booking an extra three nights here! The location is great, the staff are lovely and the rooms are terrific - excellent Starbucks coffee, good shower with nice products, lovely fluffy bathrobes and a good safe. We used the hotel restaurant too, which was very good, although a glass of pretty ordinary wine was $10 without tip!! Don't bother with the Chinese takeaway a couple of doors up - it's rubbish- but Schnippers on Times Square ( about 2 mins walk) is brilliant, and Dean & Deluca good for breakfast stuff. A super hotel that's perfect for seeing New York. Can't wait to come back!
