Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: edugaucho
Reviews.Content: Well located, between 8th and 9th avenues, this is a very nice option for travellers who want to stay near the Times Square area. The room (706) was not big, but there was a lot of space, a king size (really one) bed, a couch, a big desk (with internet connection), and a wardrobe, with a safebox and a cofeemachine inside (and also with a ironing board) The bathroom was a little smal, but very clean and functional. There was also a wifi connection, for free. There was not a fridge in the room, which was something I really missed. Metro is a few steps away, and it is not an expensive hotel (I paid about 200 dollars a night, with Otel site). I will certainly come back to this nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Joyce A
Reviews.Content: typical NY sized room - small. But the beds were unbelievably comfortable!! Bath was very clean. Good room amenities. Staff was very friendly and very accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: msgirl79
Reviews.Content: staff could not have been friendlier and more helpful. Great value and location. Very clean hotel and very comfortable beds. If you are looking for a great location at a great price...look no further. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “It was below average”
Reviews.Author: Carol60864
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing hotel! It had a stale odor upon opening the door, the room was very small and the bathroom sink had a drainage problem. The front desk service was also poor, no assistance in getting a cab and no umbrellas in the pouring down rain. I would definitely not stay here again! Also, I had forgotten, the air conditioning unit constantly cycled on and off!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ecxellent location, clean and nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: FinnHits
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with friendly service. Room was clean and comfortable, not very big but enough space for two. Free coffee from lobby every day :) Location was AWESOME! Just few blocks from Time Square and subway entrance just around corner. Great for couples and friends! Definitely would go again!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for first NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: julierickbleu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good choice for a first trip to NYC and for the price we got by booking online early (less than $200 per night). Pros: Good location, close to Times Square, Theatres, subway, Hell's Kitchen, pier for boat cruise. Clean lobby and room. Comfortable bed--felt like sleeping on a cloud. Free bottle of water in room daily, coffee in room and Starbucks coffee in lobby each morning. Free "business center" (2 computers with printers just off the lobby.) Friendly staff. Quiet enough. Loud A/C drowns out any street noise anyway. Cons A little hassle at check-in. Our rooms were "almost ready", then not. We had to get assertive and rooms miraculously ready. Basically no counter space in bathroom and one teeny, tiny triangle shelf in shower that everything falls through. Annoying! What a poor design. Car services (we used 2 different ones) apparently don't know this hotel. You have to give the address and they still aren't familiar with the block. Tip: pick up the free City Guide from the concierge's desk. Good maps, plus we used a couple discount coupons for things we were already planning to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shell_RFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in June and this was our first trip to New York. We arrived after having 8 nights in Las Vegas, we were delayed and didn't get to the hotel until 2am. We were dealt with promptly and the staff were always friendly, even in the early hours of the morning. We were placed on the 30th floor and the views were great. The room was nice and modern, probably quite a decent size by New York standards but it wasn't as nice or big as the one we had just left in Vegas. However, the room was more than adequate and there was nice dressing gown and slippers in the closet. Your got free bottled water daily and there was an ice bucket and ice was available on the lower floor where the gym was. I didn't use the gym but did have a nosy in and it looked pretty decent. Also coffee facilities in the room. The room was cleaned daily and towels and bedding changed if required, you just had to leave towles in the bath/shower and a card on the bed asking for the sheets to be changed. I didn't find the area around the hotel at all unsafe, or seedy, it is a highly populated area with other hotels and felt no different to any other side street. Although, I did nearly trample over a homeless man with my suit case on arrival further up the street! The hotel was perfectly situated for the subway and also transfers to and from the airport. We originally had booked a taxi but couldn't get through to them on my phone when we arrived, we then went to queue for a taxi. This was right next to the bus pick up line and we decided to get that instead. It was so easy and cheap to get the shuttle bus to the port authority bus station which is right across from the hotel. I would have no hesitation in returning the this hotel or recommending it to family and friends. We got a good deal and it worked out at £106 or $170, this was staying Thursday-Monday. I would recommend a nice Italian restaurant called Tramonti on restaurant row, it was our best meal of the holiday and quite reasonably priced. The bruschetta is a must, the best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ADMA
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 19-21 to see a show and a museum or two. Very quiet rooms. Not very spacious, but a good use of space. clean room. Very comfortable bed. Clean bathroom with god amenities. Slow elevators, especially at certain times of day. Fitness room small, but good quality equipment. they messed up my reservation and trired to charge me $130 extra on the second night, but changed the bill when I produced a copy of my reservation rate confirmation (so if you got a good deal--print and bring confirmation!!)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcjrdg
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 4 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are not massive but it's New York, and they are more than adequate. The beds really are very comfortable and the free wifi was a nice bonus - something that many upscale hotels do not offer. The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Times Square and directly opposite Port Authority which was really handy. There are some 'interesting' shops and buildings along the same street, but we did not feel any less safe than along many of the other streets around the Times Square area. All in all, excellent value for money and a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: adlinda1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very comfortable bed, clean, great customer service. Hotel is easy walking distance to restaurants, Times Square, theaters, hop on/hop off tour bus. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They have the guest system DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: BradS6
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC several times a year on business, and because I am SPG Platinum member, I like trying new Starwood properties - there are many to choose from in Manhattan. I have come back to this Four Points, now 3 or 4 times in the past few years. It is not on the greatest street, but the 7 minute walk to Javits convention center and the subway stop (A,C,E) a short block away, I don't terribly mind the neighborhood. For me in NYC, it is about the simplicity and ease of getting around. Should you take the train to or from Penn Station, you can actually walk the 6 blocks with luggage in tow. Or you can catch a cab going the right direction across town. Most importantly, it is always about the staff, and this hotel has trained all of them very well. Front desk manager Marcos Mendes runs quite a sharp crew. They are friendly and knowledgeable, and always willing to help with a local restaurant selection or just to offer clear directions. I am always greeted coming in and out of the property. The room is always clean and neat...For a moderately priced property, they do top notch job in guest servicing....not always the case, even with 4-6 star hotels in the city or the country for that matter. I am always amazed with my experiences with the Four Points Brand, as I usually stay at Starwoods upper level categories. This one is a good find in the multitude of offerings in NYC. Thank you again Marcos, et all. Keep up the good work. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: atave
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Four Points by Sheraton in Midtown a few months before arrival and got an unbelievably good rate considering its fantastic location. Our stay was fantastic. Check in was super quick which was awesome after a 21 hour flight. Angel who was working the front desk was very polite and helpful with everything we needed. The rooms are small but it's New York so you can't expect a Vegas sized room. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms were always immaculate. The hotel is literally a five minute walk to 42nd street and the theatre district as well as Times Square. There are a few subway stations close by and a taxi rank right in front of Port Authority Bus Terminal located across the street from the hotel. Before staying here I read reviews about the seediness of street and a lack of safety from some reviewers. You will seriously have ZERO problem. I never once felt unsafe, If you feel unsafe from a few liquor stores and adult stores then you shouldn't be traveling in the first place. There is a parole office next door but I hardly even saw it open and when it was open very quiet. Checkout was once again speedy and friendly. The bellman also got us a great deal on a private car to JFK. This hotel had it all and at an extremely affordable price. When I return to New York I will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: lliissaa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay! My husband and I shared the room with our 2 teens. While the room was on the "cozy" side (what NY hotel isn't?) we found it met all of our needs. The staff was AMAZING! We were greeted each and every time we walked through the doors of the Hotel. The breakfast staff were so efficient, kind and friendly each and every morning. The fitness center was small but adequate. The room was spotless! The concierge arranged for an SUV to take us to Newark Airport on the day of departure and saved us several dollars. Like others have said - the street isn't beautiful by any stretch of the imagination. However; it is close to Time Square and we never felt unsafe whatsoever. This is a smaller Hotel which we really enjoyed. I believe there are only 8 rooms per floor which is nice! We never heard anyone in the room beside us, above us or below us.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy enough for the money spent.”
Reviews.Author: masti_nisha
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this place is the location and that is it. The room is very small. The bathrooms look like they belong to some kind of hospitals or clinics. The shampoo, soap, etc provided by the hotel have no brand names. Housekeeping needs to be improved. They charge you like $300 per night and all the give you as complimentary is a 16FL.oz bottle of water. At least, provide 2 of them for each person in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sassysandyjean
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Hotel were very helpful. They went out of their way to help my sister and I while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: eatingfromindy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. For the price it is a great location for Times Square and the Theater District about five blocks away. It is an extremely convenient location for the subway, directly across the street from the Port Authority station. The rooms were a good size for NYC standards and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, high value option with great convenience.”
Reviews.Author: Mwtray
Reviews.Content: Our family (two kids ages 14 and 11) stayed at the Four Points for one week. Marcos the manager was great in accommodating our request for two rooms next to each other. The rooms had a view of the Empire State Building which was beautifully lit at night. They were large enough for us. Staff (particularly Alex the head bellman) were helpful and friendly. Small bar in lobby was nice respite for drink after day of seeing sights and was good place in morning for coffee. Biggest positive of this hotel is its location which was within two blocks of three subway stations that provided access to every line. It was also close to 9th Ave with tons of great restaurants. Yes, the block occasionally had some questionable characters but we always felt safe because there were always other tourists walking around (three hotels on block) and often a police officer walking a beat. Only minor complaint: our Apple devices had problems accessing free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location - our main criteria”
Reviews.Author: LeithW
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel around End May 2011. Hotel is just a block away from Time Square, right next to Port Authority Terminal ( where you take the bus to Woodbury Commons Factory Outlet) Hotel room looked refurbrished within 1-2 years and up to Sheraton standards. Small lobby. underground entrance only a few steps away. We asked for ways to go Woodbury Commons but their conceirge wasnt helpful as`they tried to get you to use their arranged transport. Its more expensive and only leaves at 10am and was`tod will take more than 90 mins journey. Instead,you should just go to Port Authority Terminal right in front of hotel and asked for directions. Its cheaper and faster ( 60 mins) and can choose your time to and fro due to frequent services.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: redbarron980
Reviews.Content: We had a girls weekend and this hotel was perfect for us. We hit the fitness center and stayed connected to the Wifi all weekend. The beds were so comfortable and I usually wake up several times a night when I am away from home. I didn't open my eyes once. The front desk were very friendly and accomodating. The location was perfect! We had a great time! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “MY NEW HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: Braden94
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this Hotel. We arrived four hours prior to check in, however a room was available and we were allowed an early check in. The rooms are standard size for NYC and I love the updated modern decor of the lobby and rooms! Most importantly...the rooms were clean too! The beds were very cozy and we did have a view of the Port Authority Bus Terminal, but we did not notice any street noise and slept very well. The location is great! Subway, Times Square, drug store (just in case you forgot an item at home) and excellent NYC pizza spots are located right up the block! A big thanks to the staff for a wonderful stay and to the Concierge who recommended the Yellow Water Taxi! What an experience for my seven year old son, the view of the city from the water was amazing...this is a MUST when visiting NYC. We were very sad to leave and head back to Atlanta, however we will be back to this Hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: yo_panda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my first trip to New York and found this hotel a great base for exploring the city. The rooms were a good size and with a kitchenette and coffee maker. The hotel was really close to lots of great shopping sites and restaurants, it was also close to the subway and bus station. The gym was great too. The free breakfast buffet and early evening snacks and drinks in the reception area was great for refuelling after long periods of trekking around the city. This is a busy, modern, hotel that I would strongly recommend to young people.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Maoslc
Reviews.Content: the Hotel is close to the Subway station. Very clean rooms and lobby. A little tight, but hey it's New York. I had a great time and the beds are awesome. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, convenient to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: BEHS75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for 4 days, following my daughter's wedding. And it was the 2nd time my wife had stayed here and we will stay here again. It is a nice hotel with an excellent and very professional staff that was most helpful. Our bill was complicated as I had three rooms all in my name as we were using a combination of my Starwood points and paying for some nights, plus my Mom had one free night under her name, but in the end it all came out correctly. My wife and I stayed all four nights on Starwood points and were upgraded to a Suite on the 32nd floor. Don't know the price, but I would highly recommend this upgrade as both rooms of the suite were very roomy, clean, modern and gave a wonderful view. The other two rooms were regular rooms and the other guests staying with us commented that they liked their rooms and that the beds were comfortable - on the nights they paid for I think it was $220 per night plus taxes. When we first checked in the air conditioner in the living room would not turn on and so I called and they had maintenance up there to fix it within minutes - turned out it was just locked. I asked for a refrigerator for my room and also got that within minutes. The bed was comforable and the entire hotel wasvery clean. The only area I would suggest to the hotel where they could improve, from my experience, was the restaurant where we ate breakfast four mornings in a row. The food was great, but at times the service was very slow, even when there were few people dining. One tip I would give is to book early, and if you can, take advantage or the Pre-Pay prices to get a lower price. We booked the regular rates in Feb or March I think for $220 at the standard rate. We called back in late June to pre-pay, but by then the price had risen to the "summer rates" and the pre-pay rate in June was higher than the standard rate in March. Always pays to plan ahead as you can cancel with not charge up to 48 hours before arrival for standard rates. Pre-Pay is non refundable but saves you money if you are 100% sure about your plans. And sign up for Starwood Points and get their AMEX card for free hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: ColandAsh
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my daughter's first trip to NYC. I reviewed many hotels on line before choosing the Four Points Sheraton-Times Square and I was a bit apprehensive booking it sight unseen. However, they definitely did not disappoint. The room was spacious and new, the king size bed was the most comfortable "away from home" bed we have ever slept in and all the staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and helpful. They made our first time trip to the city fabulous. There is no doubt that we will stay at the Four Points on our return trips to NYC. Well worth the money! ps It was very hot while we were there and the air conditioner was quiet and cold!!

Reviews.Title: “Ethernet cable blew up both our computers, day rate was expensive”
Reviews.Author: gw_london11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend of the 16th, and we had two problems: - we couldn't get wireless, so we plugged in the ethernet cable. Both of our computers now have broken ethernet ports, which involved a trip to the genius bar and $ - we wanted to stay an extra night, but the front desk rate was 3 times the rate we paid online.

Reviews.Title: “simple,but good ,friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: pieternel1952
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good, for the price we did pay. The street where the hotel is,looks not so very safe during the night. But everything is near by.

Reviews.Title: “Less than average and no Starpoints posted”
Reviews.Author: callumCampbell
Reviews.Content: The other starwood hotels were crazy pricey and so I went with the cheapest Manhattan option. It was a mistake. The hotel seems to cater for large groups of coach travellers but not to business people. The internet is super slow and despite my begging over 5 days stay ythe printer never worked. The breakfast is horrible. I would say more Days Inn than Starwood. What annoys me now is that they have not posted my points. I have written to Starwood and got a reply from them saying they have no record despite my confirmation number. Two days ag I wrote to the hotel manager asking him to confirm with Starwood that I had stayed there and he has not emailed back even an acknowledgement. I am currently on hold for him and have been for 20 minutes! Stay here if you are desperate and dont mind being right by the bus station. The Element is a much better alternative and they actuallly gave me my award points and nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in new york. Lisa and Najumas at bar/restaurant are top notch with great attitude even when it is slow. The front de”
Reviews.Author: mollymach
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms at a good price in heart of times square. I am platinum guest and treat me like a king but they treat everyone well. Street is not nice but safer than it looks. Restaurant food better than you would expect. Wish they had free breakfast for platinum guests. GM Lee is a class act.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! WILL go back!”
Reviews.Author: hvnlysinger
Reviews.Content: Perfect central location: a short walk to Times Square, but on a very calm street. The staff is warm and friendly, and the concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful. The comfortable beds even make this a perfect hotel if you just want to relax too. The room itself was a little small, but very clean. The bathroom was also spotless! I will be visiting again in August and will be staying at Four Points - Midtown!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KerryLoni
Reviews.Content: The location is near to Port Authority, subway station and Go Go Curry (walking distance). As we were staying over the weekend for the Macy's 4th of July firework, we were very glad that we reached our hotel within 15 min of walking from the West Side Highway, avoiding all the crowd that were walking to subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value / Awsome Staff”
Reviews.Author: love2travel511
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here June 26-July 1. Room was very clean with nice up to date decor. The front desk staff were very professional; every time we departed for the day or returned in the evening we were warmly greeted - very nice touch. Excellent value for the money and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My New York staycation”
Reviews.Author: FionaN_j_
Reviews.Content: I loved the room and the service, the staff was very sweet I will be back soon!!! will share this hotel experiance with my family& friends!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: coloradoga
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel. The location is good, although the block it is at is not that nice. The room is nice and comfy and the bathroom is clean. The concierge service is very good. We got an airport shuttle for a good price. The hotel is right across Porth Authority Bus Terminal, so it is pretty easy to get everywhere - by bus or subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Budhdev
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from Times Square, yet away from the noise. The staff is very good and shows genuine care. Will go back there again..

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED OUR STAY”
Reviews.Author: Bryanto
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in midtown and conveniently close to the subway - we never had to taxi. The staff was courteous and very helpful - especially Leon Leader. We arrived a bit earlier than expected, and the staff had no problems in allowing us to check in early. The rooms were clean and well kept. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: joeliz21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June with my wife had a great time!! Located literally 1 block from times square, road itself wasn't the cleanest but besides that location perfect!!! Rooms were modern and clean!!! Would stay here again great location, great rooms, well priced!!

Reviews.Title: “Functional, basic, clean”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreNYClover
Reviews.Content: Made a same day reservation last minute through hotwire at about 5pm. Checked in about 10pm and got a handicapped accessible room on the fourth floor. Room was typical size. Both the room and the bathroom were spotless, very important. Area worked fine for me, however, I could see how some people might be turned off by the area. Perfectly safe, just gritty. Really quite at night (Thursday night). Bottom line, the hotel is clean and functional. Nothing fancy. Worth the rate I paid. If it weren't for places like this, only the very rich would be able to afford to overnight in NYC which is how it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: seechel
Reviews.Content: Was taking a spur of the moment overnight trip with myson. Found this 349. a night room for 105. on Hotwire.com and after I purchased found it to be the Four Points. Great location for where I wanted to be ( 40th between 8th and 9th). Smalllobby but ceck in was quick and easy with friendly Leon at the desk. Room was pretty small but had everything we needed -including free bottled water- plus we werent planning on being in the room much. One block from Hells Kitchen, where we found a great new restaurant Marsielle. Quick walk to everywhere. Came back first night exhausted and dropped into the most amazing bed! Perfect comfort and the sheets and pillows were incredibley soft-- Im not a good sleeper but slept like a baby and wanted to take the pillows home with me! Starbucks coffee in the room ( and real cream not the powdered stuff) Easy check out - will def.stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: von_levi
Reviews.Content: My decision to stay at this hotel came down to these three factors: -Distance from where I had meetings. -My company's travel budget. -It's part of the Starwood chain (I want the points). The best thing the hotel has going for itself is that it is relatively new -- everything is clean and feels unused. Location: If I were a tourist I would not want to stay here. The hotel is located in what's probably the most touristy, congested and loudest part of the City. And the hotel itself is on a dingy street directly across from the Port Authority. As a business traveler, though, it worked for me because of the subway access. The Times Square station is a 5 minute walk away, and from there, you can get anywhere in the City. And the hotel is a 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Where to eat: if you want to eat near the hotel but escape the tourists, there are a lot of places on 9th starting in the high 40s through 50s. I also want to mention that I appreciated that the hotel held my bag for 8 hours after I checked out. Probably my only complain about the hotel was the "gym." It amounted to a half dozen machines. For a hotel this large there needs to be more machines. If I had to, I'd stay here again, but if I found something that met all three of my criteria in a less touristy part of the City, I'd go there first.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sparklegrl111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel again because of the excellent location close to times square and the subway. There are tons of restaurants near 9th ave. There is also a new lounge adjacent to the hotel called the Skyroom so it's great for drinks.I also really enjoy the customer service. Leon greeted me every time I walked through the lobby. Mons helped with my luggage and got a taxi for me. Be aware that if they call a taxi for you going to the airport it will be more expensive because its a nicer, cushy taxi than the yellow taxi. I knew this time so I just got a yellow taxi to save money. It'll save you about $10. I had nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattycEastSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights over May and June. Hotel is in a great location, no problems with the road or area. Lobby is rather small but all the staff are helpful and willing to help. Free coffee in the morning is a nice way to start your walk around New York. Rooms are a bit smaller than other rooms we have stayed in during our 4 previous trips (affina 50 and Sofitel) but for the price i could not complain. Air Conditioning is very loud in the rooms and we had to turn it off in the evenings. Overall if you want a no frills hotel that is a good price, close to Times Square, clean and comfortable you wont go far wrong with this one in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, and location is the key!”
Reviews.Author: georginaZz
Reviews.Content: The hotel's just two blocks from Times Square and it's right beside Port Authority, so you don't have to worry about transportation. The location is really ideal and made our trip a whole lot easier. Our room was on the 22nd floor and we had a nice view of the city outside the window. It's clean and meet all the standards for a good NYC hotel. The staffs are all nice and helpful. The price is reasonable. we stayed for four nights and got discount from the hotel's website so it's great. I'll stay here again for my next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: brunes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super location, being only two blocks away of all the main Times Square madness, you are close enough to dash in and out of your hotel when needed, but far enough to not have to deal with the noise and crowds. Also only 1 block from the Port Authority bus station which is also a key subway junction, making it very easy to explore other parts of the city from this hotel. The rooms were a good size and very well kept. Staff was amazing, going above and beyond by rushing a room to let us check in early at 11 AM. Free WSJ, USA Today for all guests at front desk. Free bottled water & Starbucks coffee stocked daily. Free Internet. Wifi in our room had somewhat poor reception so we used the wall jack. Beds are extremely soft, like a cloud. We did not eat at the restaurant, but it did seem pretty small. There are a lot of restaurants in the area, also a $1 / slice pizza place practically next door which actually was pretty good pizza for $1. We paid for our room using SPG points. You get a great value for your SPG points in NYC, with 10,000 points getting you a room that would be around $350+ after taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: OllieTheCat
Reviews.Content: I was in town for three days in May, to attend a trade show at the Javitz Center. This is a compact European-style hotel with mini front desk and few rooms on each floor. The room was small, but when traveling on business the most important things are QUIET and SLEEP and both of those were just fine. The staff was above average in their helpfulness and service, and were most accommodating to my requests for a room on a high floor away from the elevators. Free Wi-Fi was a plus. Safe big enough to hold a laptop. I tried the breakfast at the hotel, which was not great. So the remaining days I'd walk over to the Port Authority to get my coffee and bagel. This hotel is directly across from the Port Authority, which is not a great neighborhood. But 9th avenue is choc-full of international dining options, in fact it was the 9th avenue food fest while I was staying there so did not go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “More positives than negatives”
Reviews.Author: JLeigh2182
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, 5/20-5/22. I can't say enough wonderful things about the staff at this hotel. Every employee we encountered was friendly and helpful. They made us feel welcome from the moment we walked though the front door. We were on the 29th floor and although I'd read numerous complaints about the elevators being slow we never encountered anything out of the ordinary. The room was one of the cleanest I've ever stayed in and was appointed nicely. The only negatives were the incredibly soft beds and the air conditioning. I woke up both mornings with a sore back from the lack of support and although the thermosdadt in the room said it was 60 degrees it never felt that way. The location of the hotel was great. The subway was only a block away and we were surrounded by plenty of affordable dining options. Many people seemed concerned by the parol office, bus terminal, and 24-hour video stores but we never experienced any problems nor where we ever worried for our safety. There are at least 3 other hotels on this block so there are plenty of people walking around all the time. Overall we had a great experience with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with soft beds... Advance booking to save”
Reviews.Author: skyeyed
Reviews.Content: Be advised people...the beds are soft. If you like soft go for it. If you like firm, don't. The rooms are small, clean & functional. The location is central to times square. NY accommodation is expensive all round so I suppose $350 last minute per night is about right. Advance payment options through the hotel website is recommended to get the best rate. Do It months ahead to really save. We paid about $210 ex tax 3 months ahead. It was almost double that near the date of stay. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crakyl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and found the hotel to be extremely central beside the main bus station in NY and close to NY Times building. Plenty of restaurants and bars and close to Broadway action. Rooms were nicely fitted out but cramped for space which is not surprising. Overall a neat hotel that I would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MrHotelier023
Reviews.Content: The moment my wife and I stepped foot in the hotel for our one night stay, we were welcomed with a smile and very friendly, accomodating front desk staff. Any time we left or entered the hotel, staff always went out of their way to say hello. The room was large by NYC standards (never felt cramped for space), super clean and new looking. The Sweet Sleeper bed was very comfortable and great to sleep in after walking around all day exploring NYC. Location was fantastic. A few blocks to Times Square. Bathroom was like new, very clean and spacious. This was the first hotel in NYC that I've stayed in so far that I could give 5 stars, so I'll definitely be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal Overall”
Reviews.Author: brainman2ky
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3-Star no frills hotel in a super location for tourists and theater goers. If you drive in, there are two parking garages adjacent that cost about $24/night with the hotel discount. A multitude of vacant taxis can also be found roaming in front of the buiilding. The rooms are small but upgraded with a modern bathroom and flat screen TV . We paid $212/night at a Federal Government rate for a room with one King size bed by calling the hotel directly well in advance of our trip. Just before leaving home, I checked the hotel website online and the the price for the same room was $375. There a a few minor complaints: For example, the room air conditioner cooled very well but was extremely noisy. We could have reported it to the front desk, but it really didn't bother us enough. Also, the beds were kind of extra soft and mushy and the concierge gave us some erroneous information which created an inconvenience but not a major problem. (I've noticed that other hotel concierges at other NYC hotels have also given out outdated or erronoues advice in the past., so you have to be careful). Additionally, there are no ice or vending machines on the floors--just in the basement. But the elevators move very fast. The "free coffee" in the lobby was not hot and I couldn't find anyone in the small in-house restaurant from whom to order a takeout orange juice in the morning. Weighing the plusses and minuses, the plusses win out --this is a solid, cost-effective, clean well-located hotel in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: perky88
Reviews.Content: Staying here from April 29-may 2. Hotel clean, rooms nice and clean Service no probs Street not best but safe enough (few adult book shops a few doors down with associated people around, but like anywhere in ny lots of police so no issues)

Reviews.Title: “Small Cozy Hotel on a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Imlaris
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptic at first but I ended up being very impressed. Its a small boutique type hotel but it has everything you need plus its a few steps from all the action of Time Square. The room was very clean and quiet and the bed was extremly comfortable. The best part location, location! A few steps from the hotel you have a subway entrance and a bus terminal plus a few 24hr pharmacies and a lot of restaurants. Time Square is just about 2 blocks away an easy fast walk. Some of the reviews I read expressed how the hotel is located on a "not so good" street (there is an adult video store and a parole office close by) and well its not a Central Park type avenue but it isn't a dark alley way either, the hotel is well priced and it offers all the conveniences a tourist needs, the street its in doesnt really compromise it.

Reviews.Title: “cramped and cheap feeling, on an unpleasant block”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: This thrown-up small-footprint tower on an unpleasant west-midtown block (facing the bus station and too near the Times Square mobs to avoid them) is cramped, with cheap amenities (the bathroom was already falling apart and the cups were all plastic), Even by New York standards, the rooms were claustrophobic and poorly designed -- and this was on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor! However, it was clean, and the beds were decent, and the morning room service was quick. Furthermore, our particular room was quiet, and faced away from the bus station (with a south view toward the Empire State Building.) Still, unless you actually want to be near Times Square and the bus station, or you must stay with Starwood, you can do better for the money with a non-chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal value hotel for NY”
Reviews.Author: holycannoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. the rooms clean, the bed comfortable and located close to pretty much everything for the tourist. I see you can even buy the mattresses on their store, wonder if they ship to Australia!

Reviews.Title: “Four Points - Great!!”
Reviews.Author: mustbeme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Four Points with family in March. Perfect location, just 5 mins walk from Times Square, right across road from Port Authority which is very handy for getting the bus to Jersey Gardens for shopping!! Just at top of street (beside PA) there is a great pub/restaurant "Heartland Brewery" which served great food. The hotel itself was great, very clean, beds were so comfy. Staff were friendly & helpful. Bottled water in room. Coffee/tea facilities. Wifi available. All good! Def be going back there. Also there is a rooftop bar "Sky Room" which is definitely worth a visit at night, fab views over city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room, So-So Bed, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Huggable_Wolfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights for a family vacation (2 adults, 2 kids) and found the room to be very adequate. The room was small as expected, but this was not an issue since we did not spend a lot of time in the room (we were in NY to explore, not relax). The room was clean, room service was excellent and the concierge was helpful. The only real issue was that one of the beds was a little to soft. Some reviews mention the location (parole office, adult dvd stores, bus station) and in my opinion this was a non-issue. DVD stores seem to be on every street, so it is hard to avoid them and I don't recall ever seeing anyone around the parole office. There is a subway entrance on the same block, Times Square is a short walk and there are a lot of restaurants a short walk in all directions. For a inexpensive and quick meal try 2 Bros Pizza on 40th & 9th. We would stay here again on our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Wanderlust78
Reviews.Content: Located not too far from Times Square (about a 10-minute walk). Very clean, friendly staff, slightly dated hotel but still very serviceable and good value for money. Stayed here on business trip and had no complaints. Internet service was spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tomaddi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in february. We had done a lot of research before booking this hotel. All NY hotels in this location are expensive. This hotel seemed to offer the best balance between quality and price. We were expecting something clean and comfortable and being New York, a very small room. However the room was spacious, very clean, extremely comfortable and with a view of the top of the empire state building. The huge bed was very inviting and difficult to get out of in the morning! Some previous reviews have mentioned problems with heating. We had none. It was always warm and you could adjust the temp if needed. The staff were always helpful and helped us with a few questions about wifi etc. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food. We rarely drank in the small hotel bar as staff here were very unfriendly and the drinks very overpriced. The only downsides we experienced were the bar as mentioned and not being able to get wifi in our room. We had to stand in the hallway to get a signal. Also we needed 2 accesses to wifi and only one person could use the password at a time. However we asked and they gave my husband a second password. So we were happy with that. The free wifi was one of the things that made us go with fourpoints. So we were a little annoyed not to be able to use it on our stay. The up sides are listed below: Great location Friendly staff Very comfy bed very clean Starbucks filter coffee in room and replaced daily Free bottled water daily other things we thought you might find useful for your stay here. Make sure you have a slice of pizza from 2 bros pizza on the corner of the street if you go left out of the hotel. It is literally a minutes walk. Head left out of the hotel and at the end of the street turn right. Head up 9th avenue for loads of choice of restaurants just a 10 minute walk away. This is called hell's kitchen but don't be put off. We had the friendliest service here. And the nicest food. We highly recommend 5 napkin burgers and daltons bar and grill. You will also find restaurant row up here. We tried many bars on 9th and the streets between 8th and 9th and did not find any that we were not comfortable in. We also ate and drank in most of the heartland breweries around manhattan. Highly recommend the appetizers here for a snack with your drinks. The sweet potato fries had us hooked! Other (hopefully) helpful tips for your stay in NY. Don't go to planet Hollywood for brekkie. It's cold, overpriced, unfriedly. Just don't. Instead go to applebees. They're everywhere. Great food and friendly service. When (not if!) you go up the empire state building don't bother paying the extra for the top floor observation deck. The view from the lower floor (I can't remember the number) is better as there is no dirty glass in the way. The top observation deck is also crowded and uncomfortable. Aim to go before sunset so you can get day and night views in the space of half an hour. We highly recommend the grayline bus tours. You can buy tickets from the grayline reps in bright red jackets that can be found all over the place. We got a 48 hour all loops tours. The tour guides are good and informative. You'll pick up all sorts of tips and gems of knowledge and it gives you a great idea of what you want to see while in New York. Use the subway but get a good subway map first as it can be confusing. Take a trip to lower east side. It's more relaxed and cheaper. Walk over the Brooklyn bridge fir a view of the manhattan skyline. Take the staten island ferry for great views of the statue of liberty. It's free!! Take plenty of money with you. Everything is expensive in NY!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Good Breakfast- Good Value...”
Reviews.Author: UfukF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in here for 4 days for New York Times Travel Show with my colleagues. We chose this hotel because of its location and we made the best choice as we are only 15 minutes away to Javits Center by walking and Times Square is in a walking distance for a few minutes. Rooms are not spacious but enough size and clean. Beds are comfortable and breakfast not rich but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Bed”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: It was like sleeping on a cloud. Loved the bed in the room. Overall the place was quiet, very clean, comfortable and easy to get in and out of. The only thing is if you're on a higher floor there are many stops on the elevator, which lacks an express to the upper floors. Also, the place is next to the Parole office or something, so there are a few shady characters hanging around. But overall, it's a well kept secret - good value, and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great stay ....... great value”
Reviews.Author: Rariin
Reviews.Content: I spend 2 nights in this hotels with my friends and our stay at this hotel was great. The location, for me, it's good. just few minutes from subway station and 2-3 blocks to Times Square. I didn't feel unsafe even it is located nearby the port authority. it's still okay for me. Not bothering at all. the room is clean and nice. The staffs are nice too. The parking is just next door and the price for parking is unbeatable if you stay at the hotel and get complimentary rate. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is unbeatable, rooms small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Be_Switzerland
Reviews.Content: Location-wise, it doesn't get much better than this. On 40th, between 8th and 9th, so a little away from the craziness of Times Square and therefore a bit quieter, but still only a couple of minutes walk away. Perfect. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. About 45mins after I checked in, they called to make sure everything was OK - nice touch. Also on all other occasions, always friendly. Fitness center was not superb, but certainly good enough. In-room dining was fast and food was good. Rooms are well-furbished, a bit small, but overall what you expect from an NYC hotel, even from a good one. The range of TV channels was a bit poor and/or something did not work properly with my TV - not sure and I didn't ask somebody to check on it as it was not that important to me at the time. WiFi was working, but a bit slow. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: HJLL34
Reviews.Content: Pros -super clean -great service when we needed it -computer + printer downstairs -location: walkable distance to time square and subway stations -modern and updated rooms: flat screen TV, large windows, roomy bathrooms (although not much counter space) -value: not sure of current price, but we were able to get a night for $130 promotional value Cons: -parking down the street: but really not that much of an inconvenience since we used the subway anyway

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bilalhouri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to NYC on Christmas and from the moment we walked in, the staff were friendly and helped us get an early check-in since we arrived from the airport at noon. Room was clean, bed was very comfortable, but the thing I loved the most about the room (some people might think it's stupid, but it meant a lot to me) was a coffee machine with Starbucks filter coffee ready to be made. Location is perfect, it's a walking distance from Times Square, and it's in a relatively calm street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, perfect location...the pictures speak for themselves. The service, however, was bad. The front desk agents are kids, kids w/o proper customer service training. As far as the hotel...see the pics!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Rose-Mig
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights over New Year's Eve. The location was great for proximity to Times Square and Broadway. Front desk and housekeeping staff could not have been nicer and the room while small, was very clean and perfectly adequate. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in. Good location, good value, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Thief.”
Reviews.Author: initech
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed in this hotel in November. They provide luggage storage, which is great for our last day - we checked out, left our luggage there, and tour around the city before we left for a train. It was all great until we found out that my bf's laptop was missing in his bag. We were very very sure it was stolen during the time it sat in the hotel's storage and we even told the staff to be careful with the bag because it had a laptop in it. After this happened, we called the manager and asked if he can provide any help to check surveillance camera or ask around his staff. We even offered an award to return it. The manager was reluctant to help and told us some lame excuses that he can't spread words around his staff. However great this hotel may be, I feel extremely terrible about my stay and I disguise their dishonesty. Who knows what else they can steal? Anyway, the location is great. Sound-proof is bad we can hear some loud Italians all night. And the wifi didn't work for us. Hotel itself felt good if the laptop event didn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Loacation, Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sbenjamen
Reviews.Content: Two of us checked in on December 27th the day after a large snowstorm dumped over a foot on the city. Nick assisted on check-in and we received an upgraded room on the 32 floor. Spectacular view of the city facing Times Square. Yes. Port Authority is around the corner and that makes it a great location if you are taking the bus into the city. We drove and there was a lot next door for $24 a nite. A great value in NYC. And the subway is two streets down. Easy to get anywhere and everywhere. Some people have said the neighborhood is sketchy. But we were two blocks over from some really good restaurants and we were always able to walk to the theatre. And of course right off of Times Square. The rooms were small. But that's New York. We had two doubles. The beds were amazing as were the linen. The bathroom was modern and new. (could use a few more towel hooks). Staff were very accomodating. I have stayed at the Westin and the W in Times Square...but this Shearton beat them by miles.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Top Floors if you want to sleep...there is a dance club over the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: PourJF
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there for 2 nights...thought i rented a nice suite on the last floor...until the loud dance music started around midnight till 3 AM!!! You can hear it in any of the 3 top floors. And when I called night service, they offered me.... ear plugs! At $600 a night, you would expect that they at least inform you in advance of that "small noise issue"...for a Sheraton, this is really unbelievable. I finally got a good credit for my awaken night and got moved into a standard room for the second night (which is a bit of a downgrade when you booked a suite right). Otherwise, staff was friendly and efficient, restaurant is really not worth mentioning it and lobby bar almost inexistent. So unless you go there to party in the top floor dance club, or you really just need a nice standard room without really planning to eat on the premises (which is not a problem given the location), I recommend you go elsewhere for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gdaverett
Reviews.Content: Traveled with family with teenagers and another family. Service was great from front desk to housekeeping. Gave extra towels, coffee. Room was ok beds were very comfortable and pillows!! Very Clean Location was good, Liked having later Check out. Restaurant a bit small

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: planthenexttrip
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed, we had a relatively (for NY standards!) spacious king room on the 27th floor with great views. Would definitely recommend requesting a high floor, as well as the view, it helped considerably with the traffic noise which was also good for the location of the hotel. Bathroom was also nice - enjoyed the big, walk in shower. Overall room was clean, furnished with everything we needed. Free wi-fi was also a plus, we had good signal and it was easy to use. In terms of location I got what I was expecting. To the west of Times Sq (where the hotel is located) the neighborhoods are a little mixed, and yes the hotel shares a street with some Adult DVD stores (with tastefully whited out windows of course!) and the Parole Office, however at no point did I feel unsafe, there was so much foot traffic around and everywhere was well lit. The hotel is next to the Fairfield Inn - which has the Sky Room on the 33rd floor which I would recommend. Nice bar with cool views - think it would be awesome in the summer when you could sit outside. Overall for the price we paid (got 50% off our second night via a Starwood offer) felt we got good value for money, and it was great to be able to walk everywhere and be so close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and Service were excellent”
Reviews.Author: rrlawgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. I was hesistant to book since it was not a four or five star. It was terrific! It is on a crowded street across from the Port Authority, but was close to everything, very new, with exceptional service. We had two rooms next to eachother, a king room and a two bed room next to it for the kids. We booked to go to the Macy's Parade on Thankgiving, and the hotel was close to everything. We watched the parade three blocks from our hotel. The rooms were modern and very clean, and not tiny liike some NY hotels (not large though). I really cant say enough about it. Some tips: there is no valet parking, I recommend you pull up front and the bellman comes right out and unloads your bags.There are two parking lots on the block. If you dont need a bellman, park in the lot right before the hotel on 40th. The restaurant on the property has very good "comfort food", like pot pie and meatloaf, etc. It was an enjoyable lunch. I didnt use the concierge, but I overheard her being very helpful to a family. This hotel is a really an affordable gem. I am very particular about cleanliness. This is just as nice as some of the more expensive hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and very nice hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: KeithIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights over the marathon weekend and I believe the hotel was full. I never experienced any problems with the staff who were all very pleasant and helpful. The lobby was nice with a small but adequate bar with TV. The rooms were fine with all mod cons including a huge bed and huge TV. The bathroom was clean enough to eat your dinner off the floor as they say and had all the necessary items. I would definately stay here again and recommend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Not very clean”
Reviews.Author: sleighbells1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 5 days on March Break, we loved the location and our room was nicely appointed (although I do agree with the other comments regarding the bathroom sink) and the bed was comfortable (king). My two major complaints are that there was graffiti on the walls in the bathroom and bedroom (B!@%$) was scrawled on the walls in pencil (or pen) in at LEAST 7-8 different locations. The walls had a textured wallpaper on them so it was hard to see until it was daylight and we didn't notice it right away, so didn't inform the front desk until the next morning - their response? - "well, you never said anything last night" - my response - "We were tired and excited to be here, and didn't spend much time in there yesterday, that doesn't change the fact that there is graffiti on the walls! I would appreciate it if you would have someone look after cleaning it up." The girl behind the desk was obviously not happy with my response to her accusatory tone, which was noticed by another employee who promptly took over dealing with me. We left the hotel for the day and the graffiti had been cleaned up upon our return. However, that night, my daughter called me into the bathroom after she finished her shower to show me what appeared to be small flecks of blood splattered on the wall behind the bathroom door (I'll let you speculate about how it got there, I certainly have my own idea) Needless to say we were grossed right out, and made the decision to just keep the bathroom door open for the duration of our stay as the stains seemed to be localized to just those spots on the wallpaper behind the bathroom door, and everywhere else was spotless. I can honestly say that otherwise our stay was nice, and the room and bed were too, but I will spend more money next time to avoid such unpleasant issues, and hopefully receive better customer service. I would not recommend this hotel to people traveling with children ( my daughter is 14, so the word written on the wall was not unheard of to her, but this would have been VERY uncomfortable with younger children), and would suggest REALLY checking the room before unpacking. It's a shame that they don't have better quality control, because otherwise I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, tidy and up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: This is one of four hotels in a row on the street adjacent to Port Authority. It's not a beautiful street, but if your room faces north and is above the 10th floor, you get a decent view of times square and up till the 50s or 60s. The hotel is fairly new, or at least has been refurbished. Bathroom was decent sized with plenty of towels and basic toiletries. The only problem i had was that the bed was way too soft. It was like sleepng on a huge down cushion. Woke up with a backache every morning. The room is not huge , but adequate for New York standards. Rooms come with free internet, a flat screen TV (i think either 26 or 32 inches) and an ipod charger/speaker. the fitness room is basic but provides more equipment than most "cookie cutter" hotels such as this one. For example, there are two treadmills instead of one, two stair machnes instead of one, and a set of weights. Didn't eat in the hotel (who eats in hotels in New York city?!). Hotel staff is really friendly. For the right price, i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well planned, well executed, clean. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Elise12396
Reviews.Content: We were just in New York for the marathon. I searched and looked for a better deal right until the night before we left. I couldn't beat the rate Four Points Sheraton offered in any other chains. It was very important to me that we stayed somewhere clean and comfortable. This little hotel exceeded my expectations. The beds were too darn comfy cause we didn't want to get up in the morning! The room was small but very well planned and well executed. The cleaning staff did a great job every day. The concierge (James) was great. He was able to get us tickets to a basketball game and front row seats to Promises, Promises. There were hefty fees attached but worth it to get tickets. The location of the hotel is nice and close to Times Sq- however, it is next door to the NY State Parole Board- so the street is a bit dodgy, but I never felt unsafe. We ate in the hotel a couple of times and we both had great meals. $9 for oatmeal was a bit expensive. All in all, I would go back to NY and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: thedjlee
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - around the corner from Times Square; next to the bus terminal. If you like the look/sound of this hotel, either from this or other reviews, lock in the rate. It can go up significantly. When I first checked this hotel, the rate was $230; when I finally got around to booking, the rate was just over $300. Add on the taxes, and it was pushing $400! But I guess that's NYC... The other thing related to the rate, is that NY hotels just fill up. It's that kinda city. At the last minute, I invited a friend, as he had nowhere to stay. At check-in, I asked for twin beds - all sold out. Decide your room preference early, is the message. Another NYC thing is the small hotel rooms. This is not the smallest I have stayed in, but it was close. Nothing bad about it, just was a (small) issue, as I had my friend. Fortunately, he didn't have much luggage, as my suitcase took up some space. Did my friend sleep on the couch? There's no couch! We slept on either end of the large king bed - plenty of space between us, so we didn't end up becoming more than just friends ;-) Clean and quiet - that's all you want, right? Well, there's also free water, and free internet - woo hoo. I really do appreciate these things. As is de riguer in NYC, the concierge was knowledgable and helpful. Any not-so-great things were erased from my mind when the front desk allowed me to check out late. I had a flight out of JFK at 6pm, so I didn't leave my room till 2pm. Thank you Four Points by Sheraton Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn' have been any better”
Reviews.Author: cigatro
Reviews.Content: I could not tell you how much of a great first time we all had on our family vacation in NYC. I was greeted in the lobby of the Four Points by Sheraton by a manager Alex and the his hotel GM. Could not believe my eyes on how they treated my family and I. You would have thought we hit the lottery, when Alex noticed it had taken over five minutes to check in. (What)??? He offered us a his business card and services, giving me his personal cell phone number in case we needed anything during our stay. Alex went out of his way to get our bags, and made my children feel like royalty. Rooms were clean and quite, with great view's of the city and $25 parking right beside to the hotel. This place truly knew how to make us happy. Alex even pointed us to lunch for a $1 at two guys pizza, 500 feet away from the front door to the hotel. What a weekend thanks to Four Points and (Alex) PS there was another one of Alex's friends who assisted, he was awesome even though I cant remember his name. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “perfect location -great value”
Reviews.Author: innate18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel October 21-22nd and was so pleased! The staff was courteous and the check in was quick and easy. Loved the location. Also loved the room. The room (1503) was a average size with 2 double beds, a plasma TV, free internet access, and small but very CLEAN and functional bathroom. This room was spotless- the bathroom was spotless. The bed was incredible-- you will not want to get out! This floor only had 4 -or five rooms on it- so the noise was almost non-existent. The location is perfect for those in town for the nightlife and the Broadway shows. It is only 2 blocks from Times Square. At NO time did we ever feel unsafe walking to and from the hotel at night for during the day. You absolutely must not miss this incredible place to eat that is just one block away-Guy and Gallard. The penthouse bar at the hotel was real cool and also a not miss on the list!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel with Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: taurenlegend
Reviews.Content: I had a 5 day/4 night stay at this hotel. First of all, the room is extremely tight. I cannot imagine staying in this room with two people even if you are a couple. While the bed is very cozy, the rest of the hotel is very blah in atmosphere and mediocre staff. The restaurant has typically over-priced food with very bland taste (I only had breakfast there) and worst of all my Room Key kept failing. Twice in my short stay I had to march back down to the front desk. Wait in line for at least 10 minutes each time as there's never more than one desk attendant and a swell of travelers at all times. Coming here for work, I needed a good internet connection. It was awful and painfully slow. Their "Business Center" is one computer connected to a printer with always some schmuck on Facebook or Googling around and their "Fitness Center" is a few ellipticals and some weights. I will never stay at this hotel, nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly average, as we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: motioncobra
Reviews.Content: Service is what I would have expected from this class of hotel. Employees were pleasant and professional. We stayed on a 9th floor room which was ok but we did expect a larger room. We faced the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It was not a bad view, but not great either. There are conections for your computer a flat screen tv but no refridgerator. What I like most about the room though was the pillows. Ultral comfy and soft. Gotta get us some of those pillows. There is a resturant and bar downstairs. We used neither but did peruse thru each. It is about a 15 to 20 minute walk to Times Square. Not a bad price for the location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT: location and... BED!!”
Reviews.Author: jujumassoti
Reviews.Content: The price is amazing for the location. The room are a little bit small, but VERY new and the bed was one of the bests i've ever slept for this category of hotel. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Located in Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: niptuckman
Reviews.Content: I stay here all the time for work and look forward to being taken well care of. The staff is always friendly and the rooms are always comforting and inviting. Would highly recommend staying here for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient to the theater district”
Reviews.Author: RJG407
Reviews.Content: I was in town to see a show and stayed just one night. No bellman came out to the cab to assist with luggage upon arrival, but this was fine as I feel no need to pay someone to handle one bag. The lobby of the hotel is small but tasteful and check-in was quick and pleasant. My room was on the fourth floor, facing 40th Street and the Port Authority, and was fairly spacious by New York standards. It was very clean and all appointments were in good repair. The A/C was easy to operate and effective (although it had a tendency to rattle and I was unable to find the source of the noise). The king bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows/linens were of high quality. The room also included a fairly large flat-screen HDTV, a nice desk area, an armoire, an electronic safe, a coffee maker, and an armchair. The bathroom was sleek and modern with a spacious, glass-doored, walk-in shower (no tub, if that matters). Mirror lighting was relatively good by hotel standards. The sink was stylish and functional but offered very little counter space for toiletries. There is a small onsite restaurant that offers a few tables in a glass-roofed, atrium-style space, which was quite pleasant in the morning. I had booked a AAA offer that included a complementary breakfast served there, and the menu price for this meal would've been just under $20. The food was good and the service pleasant enough. Just outside the restaurant is a guest computer terminal and printer, which allowed me to check-in with my airline online and print out my boarding pass. Use of this equipment was complementary. The hotel is located about mid-block between 8th and 9th Avenues. While not the most attractive block in Manhattan, it was a very quick walk to the theater on 44th Street and therefore ideal for my purposes. This street can be somewhat noisy, but that's true of most of the busier areas of the city, and I travel with a white noise machine that allowed me to sleep without any major disturbances. I asked for a cab at check-out and the front desk summoned a doorman who took my one bag and walked me outside to a waiting towncar just a few steps down the block. I asked if this was a cab and the doorman said yes, but it clearly wasn't - New York taxis are not towncars and are never this clean and pleasant. Also unlike taxis, this vehicle was not metered and charged a flat rate of $45 to LaGuardia. Although not what I asked for, the experience was far superior to my taxi ride into the city and the difference in price was less than $10.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: london_loving
Reviews.Content: Room small (as with NY hotels) but very nice, good quality and with Aveda products in bathroom (which was a bonus). Dingy street but quite safe and in 2 minutes you're in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, friendliest hotel staff in the city”
Reviews.Author: seanwr
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but they are new and well taken care of. The staff is excellent, we arrived late and the front desk staff member walked to the parking garage with me and helped pick up my luggage. It is right around the corner from Times Square. The parking is cheap, plus you get a discount at the parking garage next door. The beds were comfortable and although the rooms are small, they are well laid out.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: USABRAVO
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay. Don't waste your time searching further. We have stayed all over NYC downtown to uptown. If you have many dollars to spend, then spend on. If you are spending your money then stay here. If it is your company money stay here! I would rather stay here than the Waldorf or the Intercontinental. Yes the rooms are small, but they are brand new and well taken care of. You can be on the street in a matter of about 1 minute. The older hotels in the city are not getting the remodelling that they deserve. Have you stayed at the Sheraton lately--nice lobby, but that is about it! The beds are great at the the Four Points!! The people running this hotel are great. I met TRISH an employee at this hotel--she is simply well dedicated to her job. The truly care that you have chosen this hotel. This is really a value. Don't worry about the location believe me! I would rather be here than near Madison Ave., where there is nothing to do and the restaurants all quite expensive. Here you can be on 42nd street in about 2.5 minutes. Bargain restaurants within the same time. Don't like Times Square, walk downtown towards 34th and experience more great restaurants and shopping. Parking is cheap by NYC standards here as well at the garage next door and there are no height surcharges where you could literally park a bus inside. What about one the coolest roof top bars in NYC--not a secret, but the word is not out quite yet--at least I don't think so. Can you say celebrities have been here and most have not known it. The view up top alone makes the W look like a Z. I don't work here--but I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Miimis
Reviews.Content: You can come and go whenever you wanna. I had no problems in coming back to the hotel late of night. You are just a few blocks of all the major point of Manhattan and you are also beside the subway station. The staff were fine with me and my friend, helping us with doubts, tips and also with some eletrical problems that we had. I would definetly be back there!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wendyandmick
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our recent trip to new york. We transferred from the airport by train the hotel was not easy to find due to us not having the exact address. It is situated on a street that looks a bit seedy and initially we were a little concerned, our concerns were totally unfounded as there were no problems at all. The staff were very helpful, polite and friendly. We asked for a room on a higher floor than originally given due to us reading the higher rooms were quieter, this request was given immediately. Our room was clean comfortable and quiet. The maid service was excellent and unobtrusive. we would thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: helsenhelsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for 4 nights. Very pleased with our stay. Hotel room very clean, big comfy beds and pillows, clean bedding etc and a nice size flat screen. Bathroom also clean and shower a good size. All staff we met are friendly and helpful. Ate in the restaurant a couple of times, food is really nice and staff again very friendly. There is a bar downstairs which is small but once the roof top bar opens obviously this wont matter. The street outside we found to be safe and had no problems, it is true sometimes there are people hanging around from time to time, but all ok. The shop people have mentioned previously is small, I probably wouldn’t have noticed it if I hadn’t have been aware of it before hand. My only "bad" point would be that the roof top bar was not ready when we were there despite on website saying it would be open early 2010. I was really looking forward to using :-) !!! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel - Try it, you will love it!!”
Reviews.Author: girls828687
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I traveled to NY for the very first time and I along with others was wanting somewhere as close to Times Square as possible without paying the outrageous prices. I booked this hotel back in May of 2010 and used my AAA discount and ended up paying $191.00 a night. As I read the reviews everyday until we left, I did get a little nervous about the street that the hotel was on but I have to tell you that you have nothing to worry about. We never encountered any one or anything that we were worried about. We left early each morning and didn't come back until late at night. We must have walked every street in Manhattan and never felt unsafe. The hotel is clean, the bed is awesome and the bathroom maybe a bit small but no smaller than hotel bathrooms that I have stayed in before. The staff was always courteous and friendly. Just like other people on here that have shared reviews, you're in NY... you are not going to be staying in your hotel room much at all. We enjoyed our trip and we enjoyed the city very much. We would certainly stay here again if we have the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel end of August / start of September for 10 nights and was more than happy with my choice. The location is terrific for theatre-lovers, only 2 blocks from Times Square and easy access to the Subway. W40th between 8th and 9th isn't the prettiest street in midtown, and yes, the hotel is right next door to the Parole Board, an adult shop and opposite the somewhat seedy Port Authority building, but at no time did we ever feel uncomfortable or uneasy walking to or from the hotel. Easy walk down to 34th Street to Macy's, Madison Square Garden and the somewhat less busy AMC cinemas. The room (407) was a pretty good size with 2 x double beds, a large plasma TV, and small but functional bathroom. The bed was possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Fabulous. This particular room was also at the back of the hotel, so relatively quiet and away from the street noise. The air conditioner was pretty loud though! Loved the free internet and free bottle of water each day. That was a really great selling point. Also loved the ipod dock on the clock radio - perfect for listening to some showtunes after seeing a Broadway show! All in all, a terrific stay at the Four Points, well within my budget, good service and clean and tidy room in a great location. Looking forward to staying there again on my next trip to NYC. TIP: If you're after a laundromat while you're there, head to 9th Avenue, between W40th and W39th. It's a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LolaHot
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms and 8 nights for our stay which was significantly cheaper than the two hotels next door. I didn't expect a lot so was pleasantly surprised. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The Concierge was a bit brusque but there were a lot of people waiting to see her. The rooms are typical of NYC in size, the bed is fantastic. The air conditioning is noisy but in 92 degrees it was very welcome. The bathroom was a wet room. The housekeeping was very good. We only ate in the restaurant once because we had so much planned and the food was really, really good. The halibut and the Shrimp Bisque was probably the best we had in the vicinity. When we arrived the Parole office place caused me some concern as I knew we would be going out and coming back late but the most people we ever saw outside of it was 2 and they were half asleep. Also with three hotels next to each other everyone is in the same boat so there were always a lot of fellow tourists walking back. We just walked on the otherside of the street then crossed over outside hotel. The only thing I was disappointed with was the roof top bar wasn't open and that had been my deciding factor when booking, I mentioned it to the receptionist and she just said it wasn't ready. The day before we left one of the restaurant workers advised us that we could have used it but access was from the hotel next door, that would have been nice to have known at the beginning of the break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..... dodgy area!”
Reviews.Author: theamused1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over easter and it was a great hotel seeing the sights and sounds of manhattan. Yes the street it is on is a bit dodgy, and yes it does have the parole office and a xxx store a few doors down..... but if you are booking into a hotel next to the main bus station what do expect honestly people!!! Try booking a hotel next to any bus station in the UK and you'll see what i mean! It was an excellent spot to see times square and the rest of midtown and all the main subway lines ran nearby. The rooms were very comfy and a decent size for NY. I've never had such a comfy bed in my life! As for the view we were quite high up, so it was ok just the rooftops of other buildings. The room was always clean although sometimes the coffees were not replaced which was annoying, though to be fair you could pick some up from the lobby.
