The penthouse bar wasnt open when we went but it looked good from the pics! The only annoying thing was the lifts which were a bit slow coming to the floor but fast once you were in them. Overall would recommend if you are a youngish couple on a sight seeing mission to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you can get a deal at the right time”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: I booked on SPG.com about 3 weeks in advance so got a rate of 208 USD per night. Closer to the date it became almost 500. So advice is plan your trip and book earlier. Location- Next to port authority on 40 street between 8 and 9 avenue. PA being opposite means you can get subway connections. It is a 4 block walk to times square. Location was good. Hotel- Not much of a lobby. Quite small. Old elevators and rooms looked a bit dated. Seems like this has converted to a sheraton only recently. Small restaurant in the lobby area. But hey you are in NYC. go out and eat. Tons of eating options on 9 avenue. Room- Decent size for NY standards. Free internet. Free bottle of water daily. This was a nice touch. Not much of a view from my room although I was on 30th floor. Overall- Good place for a few days in NYC and it does not break your wallet. Would advise you to choose it if you are going to pay sub 250 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: Everything from the lobby and the location to the room exceeded my expectations. Check in was pleasant, lobby is small but nice. Elevators are a bit slow, but the room was quiet, clean and the bed was wonderful. A hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay except for the taxi cab experience”
Reviews.Author: Madeline_Renton
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and daughther (12 yrs old). The hotel bed is indeed one of the nicest and comfortable bed we ever slept in. The room is very clean yet small to get a round with 2 beds in the room. Great location and very close to Authority Port so got to experience the subway to get to Central Park. The hosekeeping and front desk staff are very friendly. The only thing I didn't like about our stay is the taxi cab service. When we tried to reserved the shuttle with the Conceirge rep a day before our departure (8/21). He advised us to take taxi for $45 to JFK Airport instead of the Shuttle ($22/person). On the day of our departure, the hotel lobby attlendant called the taxi cab. It wasn't one of those typical yellow taxi cab and we were charged $65 to JFK Airport, which is more than what we were told or expected. To my surprised, I called the hotel to confirmed and this time the hotel front desk rep confirmed that it is $65 to JFK and La Guardia Airport is $45. I thought we were over charged because I checked those yellow cab as walking by times square it says on there the cost between Manhattan and JFK is $45 flat rate. It was very disappointing and next time we know better not to have the hotel call taxi cab on us.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: udomeidouwedo
Reviews.Content: It's a Four Points Sheraton. Not nearly as nice - or expensive - as a Sheraton or a Westin but decent accommodations overall. As some other reviewers have commented, the location - across from a bus terminal, next to a building that is occupied by parolees and on the same block as sex shops - leaves somewhat to be desired. I booked my room through Starwood Preferred Guest, using my SPG points, so value-wise at 10,000 points, I would certainly have expected more. But, then, we are talking about New York City. As fate would have it, our younger daughter felt sick as we got off the train from New Jersey. We got to the hotel just after noon and were told by the woman at the front desk that the rooms were not ready and that we could not check in until the official check-in time of 3:00 p.m. That's hotel policy and I quite understand it. However, we were under unusual circumstances and needed to get our daughter to bed. After waiting for several minutes in the miniscule lobby, I asked to speak with the general manager. I got the front desk manager and explained the situation to him. He promised to check around for a room and 10 minutes later, we were on our way up the elevator to our room. I might have expected the front desk woman to consult with her manager when I told her we had a sick daughter. The hotel is tall but each floor only has 8 rooms. Our room faced the back of a building and in retrospect - notwithstanding the lack of a good view - it was a good location in that we could not hear any road traffic. The beds were comfortable and the airconditioning worked well. The room and bathroom were clean and smelled fresh. After all, it is a newer hotel. As indicated at the outset, the location is not for everyone, particularly those faint at heart, as one is very likely to encounter what one might consider as "undesirables" as one walks towards Times Square. It did not bother me as I am used to New York City and its "surface dirt." In short, things are always better than what they appear. My only complaint was that the front desk woman could have been more sympathetic than the route she chose to take, which was to go strictly by the book.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsafe location!”
Reviews.Author: Kenycar
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is fairly new, the hotel itself was ok, rooms are on the small side. The problem with this hotel is the location. The street where this hotel is located is scary as hell. First off the building adjacent to this hotel is a parole building for the criminals of new york city. We came out in the morning and there was a line of parolees about 50 people deep waiting to get in to see their parole officers. Not a crowd we wanted to encounter while on vacation. Upon returning to the hotel that evening it was evident that this street is a transvestite prostitution location. There is a porno shop a few doors down from the hotel, and this appears to be the centralized location for the prostitutes. There was also blatant drug sales going on right in front of the porno store. We were asked if we wanted some "weed" as we passed. I would definitely not recommend this hotel unless you are interested in seeing the sites that I just mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again. Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Shar68
Reviews.Content: we were booked into this hotel for 3 nights and we booked two rooms. On arrival we were informed that our rooms were not ready. This was not a problem as we arrived earlier than the stated check in time. We left our luggage at the hotel and went for some lunch and a look around Times Square. We returned a few hours later and our rooms were still not ready! At this stage we were all very tired. The girl at reception was not the most pleasant of people and seemed irratated by the bother. We all sat in the lobby waiting for rooms to be ready. The bathroom in lobby was messy and alot of water was on the floor which was slippy. We eventually got so fed up and felt so disappointed by this hotel that we asked to speak to a manager. We explained the situation and he offered us breakfast vouchers for stay . Our room size was as expected as we've stayed in NY before. I felt house keeping was of a very poor standard. The valance sheets in both our rooms were filthy. The furniture in the room shabby. We found popcorn and blueberries on the floor in our room. There were hairs on the towels. On the wall behind the door there was a large mud (?) stain. In one of our rooms the toilet would not flush properly. There were no glasses in both rooms. Tea and Coffee were not replenished at all in both rooms during our stay. On our first morning going to breakfast, there was broken glass in the elevator! Not a great start to our holiday! The vouchers were were given for breakfast meant that we could not choose an item cheaper than than the stated voucher. So we ended up paying $22 for orange juice one morning. Other mornings we bought other breakfast items that were half the price of the voucher. Didn't make sense to me! The staff in the breakfast room were lovely and professional. I found the front end staff at this hotel not too happy to be at work. The girl who was on reception when we were was rude and irratated by any request. It was more a smirk than smile we got. On leaving this hotel we stored our luggage at the hotel and went shopping for a few hours. On our return and while waiting for our luggage we could hear people complaining about their rooms not being cleaned and others sitting waiting for their rooms to be ready. This hotel was busy whilst we stayed and seemed understaffed to deal with it. The location was good for Times Squrare etc. The area the hotel is in is a bit seedy. I didn't feel unsafe just a bit uncomfortable at times. My main problem was how we were treated by the hotel and the dirty rooms. I Would not have confidance in this hotel to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: sparklegrl111
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. The staff really went out of the way to make sure I was comfortable. When I had first arrived, the staff was pretty busy, but Mons still took the time to help carry my baggage to the room and made sure I was ok. I have to disagree with other people who say it's in a seedy location. 40th street is in between 8th and 9th avenue. There are two adjacent hotels. 9th avenue if full of restaurants. 8th avenue is near the New York Times and times square. It's such a great location. When I checked out, the hotel let me check in my luggage while I killed time before my flight. They do not offer shuttles to the airport, but they did call a cab for me and it was waiting for me when I had to go. It wasn't a yellow cab, but a nicer more cushy one. It was $45 plus $5 for toll to Laguardia airport. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but good for the price”
Reviews.Author: hairess09
Reviews.Content: Our room had the most comfortable bed, ever! (King size) The size of the room was pretty spacious for NYC and we enjoyed our stay. One of the quirks of our hotel was the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. No matter where we moved the nozzle, it still went thru the cracks of the glass door and soaked the floor. The carpet was somewhat dirty and had a big stain that was crusty... but other than that the room itself was nice and I was surprised by the space after hearing how tiny NYC hotel rooms can be. The area outside the hotel isn't the nicest area, but I never felt scared even late at night (maybe if I were alone but my husband was with me) It is next to a parole office so in the mornings on my way to work, there would be 10-15 parole's waiting outside the building and there is a "porno" store down the road as well but there is nothing visible from the outside. (You will find these same type of stores heading into Times Square, so it's interesting people judge the hotel because of this) The plus is that it's conveniently located to 9th Ave which has a lot of local good restaurants, and it is also close to a Subway entrance. There is also a computer with free internet downstairs to use which was really nice. Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful In a great location”
Reviews.Author: jfburrows
Reviews.Content: Compact Rooms, do go swinging the cat, but they are well laid out and very clean. Staff was helpful and the breakfast was a bargain. Easy walk to Broad way and all easy access to subway. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corriegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points-Sheraton August 13, 2010. The staff could not have been better! I'm a smoker so I had to walk in and out of the hotel SEVERAL times and every time I walked in to at least two employess with huge smiles saying hello. The room is pretty tiny but has everything you need. They need to rethink the bathroom though. The shower has no bottom so the bathroom floods. Also, the only good light to use for your makeup is in the bathroom. The sink is way too long and it's hard to get close enough to the mirror to see what you are doing. I wish they would have an ice machine on each floor. You have to go down to the cellar to get ice. I knew that there was no bath tub or fridge so I brought a blow up kiddie pool to put our drinks in. : ) We had to drag it down to the bottom floor then use the elevator to bring it back up. Needless to say everyone that saw us was very amused. Bed was very comfortable although I only slept in it for an hour. It was still very nice. Lastly, they need more elevators. When we were leaving we waited 20 minutes for an elevator. A new one came every 3-5 minutes but was full. I ended up having to use the stairs with my big suitcase which landed pretty hard on my foot. I told the woman at the desk that they need more and she grinned at me and agreed. Very sweet woman. So overall I would stay here again. Only 2 blocks away from times square. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, just a couple of quirks”
Reviews.Author: aesull
Reviews.Content: I was really glad to have found a reasonable (in New York terms) hotel close to where I needed to be in Manhattan. Staff was friendly, hotel is clean and modern and the ultra-comfortable bed was a pleasure to come "home" to each day. The room was small, yet larger than I expected for the price. The bed is just large enough to make the room seem smaller, but it's worth it. Some have mentioned being bothered by the ice and vending machines being all the way on the bottom floor; I don't know if I was bothered, but then again, I didn't see myself getting any ice. The floor of the open shower was level with the surrounding bathroom tiles, making it very easy for water to spread out in the bathroom. I had to make booms out of towels to trap it near the shower. Weird design, but hey, it's their floors. I worked around it. Overall a real pleasure to stay here."

Reviews.Title: “Basic good hotel for New York”
Reviews.Author: suomeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during 8 nights in July. Even though I would choose a different location than Times Square for my next stay in New York, this hotel was clean and nice. For travelling with a 9months old baby, the room was a bit too small and there was not refrigerator available, but an ice machine in the cellar.

Reviews.Title: “Would DEFIITELY Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: ireg
Reviews.Content: Just outside of all of the madness found in Times Square the Four Points proves to be a great place to spend a night despite the massive amounts of tourists. The bedding was spectacular (in fact, I ended up buying some of the Sheraton bedding because I liked it so much), the room was small, but very comfortable. The bathroom could have used some heavy scrubbing, but it was still usable and pretty clean. The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly. My only true complaint was that my coffee maker was busted, so I had to head out to buy a cup which turned out to be nice because I discovered some nice eateries about 4 or 5 blocks north and west of the hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised with the experience and would definitely return if I were looking to spend the night in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't choose this one again”
Reviews.Author: dallastripster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. We had 2 rooms on the 25th floor. The elevators and halls are not air conditioned and we were there during a heatwave so it was pretty stuffy. They appeared to have some trouble with their key system as we had to go down for new keys 2 times and both times other people were getting new keys as well. The rooms were extremely small as were the bathrooms. The beds were way too squishy which made for an uncomforable sleep. The only ice machine/soda machine is in the basement. We called for an extra pillow/blanket and it took 3 calls and 5 hours to get that. The guy that delivered it apologized and explained he was teh only person on duty in housekeeping in an over 30 story hotel. The location was questionable. We had a senior citizen and 2 children with us in our party. It is several big blocks to Times Square - so don't be confused by the name of the hotel. You have to walk by a parole check in place, a peep shop, porn shop, etc. on the way. Overall I would say the service at the hotel was lacking. The desk workers and the concierge always seemed a bit irritated and over worked. There was no doorman/bellhop to assist with luggage. It was definitely a do it all yourself type of place.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: luv2traveleasternUS
Reviews.Content: Four Points Sheraton was an unexpected pleasure. The room was ample for me, a solo traveler, and perfectly located right next to the Port Authority. In spite of its immediate neighbors, I never felt uncomfortable walking alone. The contemporary, new decor is perfect for New York. The bed was, as previously reviewed, wonderfully comfortable. The room size was comparable to most on NYC. Flat screen TV helped make the room seem larger than it actually was. And my room faced away from the street so it was incredibly quiet. The only negative observations I can think of are: the bed tended to slant toward the middle - perhaps it was an older mattress with a newer pillowtop? Also, yes, the single-handle bathroom fixtures took some getting used to. I am a woman and in the bathroom, I would have appreciated a stool or ledge in the shower to prop my feet so I could shave more easily. Also, the electrical outlet was in the bathroom was too close to the classy glass vanity shelf, so I was unable to plug in the hair dryer. The concierge was very helpful during the day. However, in the evening I asked the desk clerk for a recommendation for a 'nicer', eclectic place for dinner, and even after repeating myself three times he said he didn't know what eclectic meant, and directed me to his favorite seafood restaurant downtown (which was excellent, but not what I was expecting.) Room service ( breakfast) was exceptional -- delivered quickly and accurately and the server was extremely humble and polite. Kudos to this gentleman for making a stressful morning go more smoothly!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: chijames
Reviews.Content: At face value this hotel was everything I expected from a Four Points. Small but clean rooms, very friendly staff, convenient location in Midtown (although note that the area is NOT pretty. Overlooks the Port Authority crowded with nasty people). What I didn't expect were bed bugs! I woke up on Saturday morning with a few small bug bites but had assumed that it was from being outside the evening before. However, I woke up Sunday morning with even more and clusters of them!! I googled bed bug bites and found tons of photos that matched my bites exactly. When I checked out, the front desk staff was apologetic but not mortified as I would have expected. I asked to speak with a manager and was told that none were in the hotel at the time and that I would receive a phone call as soon as the manager arrived. That was over 24 hours ago and I haven't received a call yet. The front desk insisted that this has never happened before but whether that's true or not, there has to be a first time. My advice, STAY AWAY! There are PLENTY of other affordable, clean hotels in midtown!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Joben180910
Reviews.Content: The 1st time we had gone to NY, we had stayed in N.J. It was far and took us over 90 min. to get to NY. This time we searched all travel engines and with Expedia, we found this hotel at $155/night for 4. The room was small with 2 double beds; the matresses were quite soft. The bathroom was ok, with only a shower, no bath. The only thing missing was a counter to put our stuff. There was none. Not a great view but who cares, we were not there to be inside all day. We were there to shower, change and sleep. The handy man was super nice. But the main thing with this place is where it is situated. A few blocks from Time Square. Subway at the corner. We were very happy with that. Parking is $24 per day. Not expensive for parking in NY. Overall, we would have liked to have a bigger room but all in all, it was a great place to stay. In itself, it was quiet but early mornings, outside, there was some noise. Hotel staff was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: benzee24
Reviews.Content: I booked this room with Hotwire without knowing if it will have one or two beds, of course it only had one King size bed, so the check in person gave us the room with a chaise loungue. Of course the Bed was so big and comfy that my cousin and I borth slept on it, plenty of room to spare. The hotel was very close to the Subway station, and only a short walk to Times Square. People who whine about how far Times Squre are too lazy, why are you even traveling? And I didn't even notice the Parole office until I read about it here after the fact, it's fine. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: cjrdh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to NYC over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is clean and nice and the bed and pillows are super comfy. The hotel is very close to Times Square and within walking distance to Rockefeller Center (if you don't mind a good walk). It is very convenient to many restaurants, cafes, diners, drugstores, and souvenir shops. We asked for a room on a high floor and were given one on the 23rd floor. The view of the skyline was nice and we were able to see the fireworks over the Hudson river from our window! I would stay here again if I wanted to stay in the hustle and bustle of everything because it was a great value; although if I do go back to NYC then I'd probably choose a quieter area like Greenwich Village or near Central Park since I've already done the Times Square thing. My only complaint: when we were checking out, the conceirge offered to get us a cab. Much to my surprise, it was a town car NOT a cab. The fare was going to be $45 to LaGuardia! When we arrived in NYC we took a cab to the hotel from the airport and it was only about $30 or maybe less. I told them we would like a regular cab, the conceirge "negotiated" the fare and we ended up paying $40 before tip. I wish I had just said no and gotten a cab. I don't care about the extra money, but its the principle!! I felt like I was being nickel and dimed! Beware....just say "no, I'll get my own cab" or be very specific that you want a REGULAR cab. A town car is not worth the extra $10-20! Other than that, its a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoo-ma-goo
Reviews.Content: I thought that this Sheraton was really just a little gem in the heart of the city. It was very clean and the rooms were immaculate. It was extremely hot in the city ( nearly 100) and the air conditioning worked fabulous! The room was a total pleasure. I thought that the rooms and the bathrooms were on the small side but I would stay here again. They even have a great little restraurant in the hotel tath serves a deiicious breakfast. The location is great but it is right next door to the New York Parole Department adb acriss teh street from the Port Authority. It did not bother me at all. I felt safe walking around the area. One more item...the beds were extremely comfy!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scary Location”
Reviews.Author: emperoriuke
Reviews.Content: I guess when you have the New York City Parole Center a block away you should expect a few scary characters hanging out along the street you have to walk back to the hotel on. Not a nice walk when you have your family with you. We also had to wait until 3:45 pm to check in although thier check in time is stated as 3:00. They're excuse was that housekeeping had't cleaned all the rooms yet. They offered no solutions other than to say sorry but after a long flight and cab ride that just didn't cut it. On the plus side the rooms we're decent and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: Hardb
Reviews.Content: Great little Sheraton within easy walking distance of TImes Square and Broadway. There are only 3-4 rooms per floor which was nice made it a nice quiet stay and of course the quality you expect from a Sheraton. The only con...it is on a very seedy street right across from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and the street itself is well....seedy....we saw our first NYC rat....it was the size of a small cat...I had my husband with me so the walk didn't bother me but...if I was by myself I would not have stayed here because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Four Points by Sheraton Midtown's feature is its great location. It's near the train, also walkable from the Bolt Bus and from Times Square. Felt safe going home late at night (although yes, there are a few seedy characters nearby). The room was moderate sized. The bed was comfortable. Free bottle of water. Free high-speed internet. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MartaZanchi
Reviews.Content: Despite having a rehabilitation centre and sex shop near the hotel, I felt extremely safety. The hotel was situated about three blocks from Time Square, the subway has a lot of lines, and is one block from hotel. Helpfull satff, confy beds, Lcd tv, free high speed internet, quiet room...very good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great accessible rooms--just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: cammary
Reviews.Content: Anyone with a disability knows that 'wheelchair accessible" rooms don't always hit the mark, but this one does. Bathroom worked very well with large roll in shower that didn't leak out. Neighborhood wasn't the best, but we felt safe, and the hotel was in easy walking distance to restaurants, Times Square, and other major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: kats012
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on Hotwire as a secret hotel (described as 3 star in Chelsea/MSG area) - 3 nights for around $300. It is a very convenient location - just a couple of minutes walk to the Times Sq subway. The room was very clean, comfy bed, decent shower etc. There is a construction site outside so the view was not great, but noise didn't bother us at all. The aircon however is very noisy! It's perhaps not as flush as you would expect for a Sheraton hotel, but for a few comfortable nights in a clean hotel in a great location, for this price, was perfect - we were out most of the time anyway. We also stayed in the Marriot next door, which was practically identical (also loud aircon!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great concierge”
Reviews.Author: MaineacFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April for 5 nights with my 2 children, ages 8 and 11. Having vacationed in NYC several times, I had wanted to stay at the nearby Hilton because of its location, but it was booked. However, the Sheraton was absolutely wonderful. The location was perfect. We could easily walk to Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. There are a large number of great restaurants in the area as well as easy access to two subway lines. The concierges were terrific. One of them especially (I can't recall her name now that it's been 2 months, but she's an African American woman probably in her late 30s or 40s) was wonderful. She went ouf of her way to make sure my son's birthday was special, and gave us great tips on wonderful and affordable restaurants. The desk passed the concierge desk in the lobby that sells tickets is not part of Sheraton. We purchased show tickets from both the concierge and the ticket desk. There seem to be advantages and disadvantages to both, which I'm not fully sure of. Our room package came with breakfast. i would highly recommend this combination. The breakfast bufffet is terrific, and it allows you to eat a large breakfast, eat a small lunch (snack, really), and eat out in the evening, therefore only buying one meal per day. The breakfast buffet purchased separately is fairly expensive. The room was very adequate with very comfortable beds, a large tv screen, and good (via a cable) internet service. We will definitely be staying at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with easy access to all Manhatan”
Reviews.Author: Monster145
Reviews.Content: Despite having a rehabilitation centre and sex shop next door we never felt threatened or scared in this location. The hotel was situated about three blocks from Time Square and is next door to the massive bus terminal and New York Times Building with a subway at end of the street. The rooms were very clean and sufficient for a short break, although the air conditioning can get noisy after a while. The top floor bar is still not open despite being told it would be finished by the end of May,although there is a lounge bar, and whilst not full of atmosphere, it serves beer which is needed after a long day sightseeing! Staff were extremely helpful especially to us NY virgins!! We never ate at the hotel so cannot comment on the food but they were fine with us eating our food in the bar one evening. The overall experience was absolutely fine, room was quiet of a night and whilst we booked this as a package I'm sure it would represent far better value than the hotels in the heart of Time Square?

Reviews.Title: “Great location clean comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Memell
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 nights with my partner arriving half way through our stay. IT was in a fantastic location. The bed was excellent and there was plenty of room. The only negative was the restaurant we had room service one night, which was terrible for the price, but what do you expect I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BrittanyOne
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I spent the long weekend happy that we chose the Four Points Sheraton. The location was ideal for shopping the fabric stores and walking up and down looking in the jewelry shops. Our rooms were very clean, updated, quiet and roomy enough. We liked the little bar off the little lobby, as well as the convenient breakfast room with free coffee. It was nice to have free computer access downstairs so we could print our boarding pass, as well. The staff, especially at the busy front desk was very accommodating and genuinely happy to help us. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: DelawareGrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent travelers to NYC, both for business and pleasure, so we've stayed at a few hotels. The Four Points was, granted, not the most plush but it was a great affordable option. Very nice, two thumbs up from these travelers!! The rooms were clean, nicely appointed, and looked new (or newly renovated). The bed was very comfortable, and the room darkening shades rocked! There was a flat screen TV, a nice duvet, and FREE water. What a nice perk!! The room was, typically for New York, a little cramped but the two of us had plenty of room to get ready at the same time. After all, who stays in their room while in NYC?! The location was really good too. A block from the Port Authority (the hotel is literally across the street; granted, not the best view but very convenient). Also, it's only 2 blocks to 42nd street and 5 to Times Square! Yes, as some other reviews mention, you do have to walk past about 5 sex-tape stores, but that's kind of par for the course around 9th Ave. I didn't feel unsafe at all. The front desk staff was very helpful -- check in and check out was quick and painless, and they even helped me find the closest bank branch without giving me attitude. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: 2bhavinfun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought my inlaws for a sight seeing vacation, got king rooms for each couple, stayed four nights. The hotel is great, the location iis perfect. I slept very well and enjoyed a nice warm shower each day, very important because we spent many hours each day touring the city. Did eat breakfast at the hotel, expensive, but not bad food. The only problems were 1. the stand up shower leaked water all over the floor every time I showered and I never did figure out how to make that not happen. 2. the bathroom sink, while very modern in design, requires you to turn it on full blast to get hot water and it sprays all over when you do that! It was the least expensive hotel in it's class when we booked, not sure it is so inexpensive now from what I have seen the rates have gone up a bit. Felt like we got a great deal and really enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect, the 1/2 block of junk everyone talks about is really nothing to be concerned about and we didn't have any trouble getting a taxi as there is a taxi stand 1/2 block away on the corner, we caught a limo for $15 to Grand Central at 10:06 AM and were at grand central, got directions, bought tickets and were on a train by 10:25 AM, not bad at all! We used the greyline hop on hop off bus and really enjoyed it, stops are close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: dfgdave
Reviews.Content: Spent one night, a Saurday night, here. It was a family get together and we chose NYC. Some of the group went to a show while others decided to walk Times Square and the surrounding area. The hotel staff were most helpful. Early check in? One of three rooms was ready so we put luggage there. The front desk folks were awesome and Alex was a whirlwind of a guy that always smiled and knew everything. Nothing was a problem for him. The rooms were of average Manhattan size, bed was comfy and the bath was fine. No tub but who cares? I am not getting into a tub unless I sanitize it myself so this was no biggie for me. Free internet and bottled water. Not a rapacious 3 to 5 bucks for a 25 cent bottle. The center of Times Square was two blocks away so it was very convenient. Very safe area in my opinion. We got a late check-out (2pm) and it was given with a smile, not like they were going out of their way to do us a favor. I never get it when a service provider acts like they are dong you a favor when it is the customer doing them a favor by choosing them instead of another establishment. Next time we are looking to stay in the Times Square area we will stay here. The place was very nice but the people made the difference between very good and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Two Blocks from TImes Square”
Reviews.Author: JNagowski
Reviews.Content: I was in town attending the Big East Basketball Tournament at Madison Square Garden. We stayed here because we wanted to be near times square. I had never been to NY so it was really nice to be around a lot of tourist attractions within walking distance. Everything seemed to be a short walk away and also MSG was only a few short blocks away. They had a very attentive Front Desk staff and concierge. When I was there in March the rooftop bar had not opened yet but I hope to come back when it is opened. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A awesome hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: monsey-moo
Reviews.Content: After spending weeks looking at hotels on Expedia we settled on this hotel due to its great price and location. We turned up late in the evening and checked in very quickly to a very nice and excellent sized room. The room was very clean with a huge bed, good sized bathroom and excellent room facilities. The bed was incredible - huge and super super comfy! The room was quiet and had easily controlled air con so wasnt too hot or cold. The location is the best thing about this hotel, in 5 mins your are in times square:) Dont listen to 1 negative word about the reviews about the road the hotel is on being dodgy. We were in this hotel for 5 days and not once did we feel uncomfortable walking down the street day or night. There are a couple of smutty dvd shops but thats it! Compared to other cities this really was no problem at all. The hotel is very close to the port authority which makes it ideal for getting a bus to any of the airports in NY (saving a lot of money!) If you stay here i'd recommend eating at the Westway diner its just a few blocks away and is probably the best place we have eaten at for brekkie and is very well priced. Check out the hells kitchen flea market on a wknd its very close and you can grab yourself a bargain or some interesting items. While in NY we particularly enjoyed Greenwich village and the Soho districts. If you want a nice steak meal go to Benjamins steak house - WOW seriously the best steak we've ever had and its a not too far to walk to. When we come back to Manhattan we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “modern and reasonable price in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: 27_Madrid
Reviews.Content: Hotels in NYC are very expensive, with little rooms and often old. So it is really pleasant to go to this hotel, with modern bathrooms and decoration, cosy and stylish, and pay less than what you'd pay for other traditionally known hotels in the city. You've got free internet too, and Timer Square around the corner with the subway too, so the all-around experience was really good, the best that I've had in New York, even compared to more luxurious hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location@bus-terminal!, Clean, Uptodata,”
Reviews.Author: dan_berlin
Reviews.Content: Rooms: good size of the room. king size bed with a bit too soft matrices (for my taste). desk for working - including wired and wifi for FREE in room and troughout the hotel. chair , a/c unit in room. small shower bath, some rooms do have a bath tub. Hotel: Central location close to the TimesSq. and Broadway (5 min walk) Bryant Park is within 8 min walk to reach. A bit noisy due to the traffic all night longs, esp. if you prefer to open the window for air. street view rooms face the bus terminal. restaurant, business center with a single PC and work-out rooms available. Hotel Bar serves std. drinks and beer. Though closes sharply at 11pm! Eventhough the bar was crowded with people. Really ashame. Good located between Financial District and the Shopping areas on 5th Avenue - and close to Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “The website to this hotel doesnt tell you everything.....”
Reviews.Author: the12thmanseattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents to NYC for the first time, this past week. The website to this hotel showed some great photos! location looked great, etc. We got there and a few things were a bit different. First off- what they fail to tell you is the location of the hotel is literally right next door to the New York City Parole Center...as well as on the same side of the street about 6 adult book stores, liquor store, etc. We arent prudes lol we thought it was actually really funny that no one mentioned any of this in any of the reviews....but after we came back and forth from the hotel many times, passing all of these locations, its not really the kind of people you want to hang out with. I would think the Sheraton would have done a bit better with this. Its pan handling central, drunks on the sidewalk, etc. all of it is something you run into, getting in and out of your hotel. The vending machines....nothing in them is cold. all of the soda is warm, etc, and they didnt work. It cost us $9 for 2 cans of soda because the machine kept eating the money and the person up front we talked to said they couldnt do anything about it...super. The beds are absolutely awesome...so soft, you just fall right asleep! The lobby is really small, but clean, the staff is wonderful, the do yourself a favor and stay away from the restaurant. Its called the "gotham bistro" however it looks like a conference room that has some tables added. the server we had was wonderful and the fact that everything sucked wasnt his fault. we tipped him well because he was just wonderful. we ordered breakfast...a "stack of pancakes" was $12. when they came out, they literally were the size of a lid on a large "to go" soda cup from a fast food restaurant, and they were paper thin. the "stack" of pancakes was 3 of them. you could tell they were the type of pancakes that you just had to microwave to cook them. i ordered my breakfast and just had the classic...bacon, 2 eggs, toast and homefries. i asked for my eggs to be over medium. they came out hard as a rock..no yolk, etc. the bacon had clearly been sitting for several hours...and every one of the meals we got was cold. our breakfast, for 4 of us, was $70....re-freakin-diculous. I should have went to mcdonalds instead.. keep in mind...we arent picky people...we roll with the punches, but this stuff just stood out and we really arent complainers. when everyone thinks the same thing...something is wrong... oh and here's the kicker...our train left at 7am, so we needed a cab at 530am (we were heading to boston before coming back home to seattle) and we asked the front desk the best way to go about that. the lady kindly let us know that in NYC you cant call for a cab....and that the hotel doesnt have any cabs that time of the morning so we would have to take all of our luggage to the next block and get a cab there....PASSING THE PAROLE OFFICE, THE LIQUER STORE, ETC AT 530AM WITH ALL THE CRAZIES OUTSIDE GOING THROUGH THE PANHANDLERS, ETC. yeah...not safe. they didnt seem to care.......they said oh well, you have to take your luggage and walk. 4 adults, 6 pieces of luggage...not cool.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to come back! A hidden jewel!”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoyoyo
Reviews.Content: Staff was great! Room was awesome! Size of room, can't complain about it for NYC, king bed was sooo comfy. Parking structure across the street, can be a little noisy during the weekday AM hours, so try to get a room away from the front of the property. People with big city experience won't be intimated by the industrial feel around you or the couple of seedy video store & liquor stores you have to pass by on your way back from the center of town, they're harmless. Convenient little bar for a quick cocktail to winddown from a day of sightseeing or before you head out for the night. Can't wait for the opening of their new bar with a view of the city, on the top floor. Restaurant is slow and expensive, staff is even slower wouldn't waste my time if you have options... Gym is sufficient to get in your cardio!

Reviews.Title: “Lacks character. Unlike the city around it.”
Reviews.Author: hedonist_traveller
Reviews.Content: Regardless of the purpose of your trip, I can recomment this hotel for its location: this is a perfect base to explore the many things that NYC has to offer -- pretty much of it on foot. And if you are a business traveller, connections to both midtown and downtown offices are great. The hotel sits on the Southern extremes of what used to be -- before gentrification took its course in the 90s -- the Homorrah of Hell's Kitchen. There is plenty of surviving adult entertainment in the area, a parole station a spit away, and the proximity of Port Authority (a long-distance bus terminal) makes the immediate environment a lively one. To be fair, the slick New York Times building is also very close, and they have some nice restaurants there. The lobby area, for all its pretence to style, is the smallest I've seen at a hotel. The room was decently sized for NYC and freshly renovated, but don't expect any thrills. No bathrobe, no slippers. A glimpse into an office life for a view. Breakfasts hearty but unexciting. Staff responsive, not proactive. At the moment of the booking (about ten days in advance) Four Points was slightly cheaper than the other Midtown hotels of similar class, and had more rooms available. The SPG program threw in quadrupple bonus points. Hence the choice which I do not regret, but there's hardly more to it..

Reviews.Title: “A closet with a window, overlooking an alley!”
Reviews.Author: charmelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks for business. Needless to say, the rooms are TINY with no counter space in bathroom and no closet. Not very convenient for long stays. No water pressure from sink or shower. Room smelled like urine so I cleaned it myself. Everything about this hotel is tiny! The street it sits on is a lot like a tiny, narrow alley. The lobby, bar, restaurant, and elevators are all claustrophobically small. There are only 4-6 rooms per floor and barely enough room for two people to pass each other in the extremely narrow halls. I can say that it was quiet and the staff was very polite. Relatively close to Javits Center.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel, but a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: khargrove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, and the section we were in was very much in need of renovation. Typical of a NY hotel, the bathroom was small but adequate. The bed was very comfortable, although there was not lounge chair, only a task chair. The cleanliness of the room was fine, although one day housekeeping was very late. The worst part is that the hotel has a "two-pipe" air conditioning system, and when we were in NY it was very warm. The windows only opened a little, so it was hot in the room. Fortunately, we got enough air at night to sleep, although we also got dirt and noise (25th floor). The corridors are dark and the carpet desperately needs replacing. I wrote the manager of the hotel because I didn't get the kind of room I was promised. He wrote me a very nice response, apologizing, and awarded me 8000 Starwood Points for taking time to right. The location is fabulous--just a few blocks to Times Square, the MOMA and Folk Art Museum are a block away. I would definitely stay there again if I could get it at a good rate. I would recommend if I disclosed the problems, above.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would definitely return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: valerie2107
Reviews.Content: The central location of this hotel was great, all the major siteswere within easy walking distance. Tthe twin room was adequate, once we figured out the air conditioning/heating system it was more comfortable, the starbucks coffee machine was a bonus. All staff were helpful. The pool on the 5th floor looked good, pity we didn't have the energy to swim after a full days sightseeing. The only downside was no opening windows, but then we were on the 14th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: DiMartinoM
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, new, rooms a little small but it's NY! Def good location, close to everything. Loved the way the place smelled :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, don't worry about the "location"”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMikey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the NYC Marathon in November. We worried about some of the negative reviews with respect to ongoing construction and the location, but these worries ended up being baseless. The location is great! Only a few blocks from Times Square, MSG, Hells Kitchen, the Conference center etc... The transit station is 1/2 a block away as well. There was some construction going on that caused a few traffic concerns on our block, but since we were walking, we had no issues. Another hotel is going up right beside this one, but construction noise was kept to a minimum. There were some worries about the "clientele" around the area, but we experienced no problems at all, coming or going in the evening or morning. It is obvious that this area is undergoing a dramatic transformation from run down and a bit on the sleazy side, to a more upscale and touristy area. Don't sweat the small stuff, another year or so, and this will become a very preferred location. The hotel was friendly and accomodating. We ended up with a "one bedroom" suite on one of the top floors that had a great view and that was very comfortable. While it had a few cosmetic flaws...nothing that caused any grief. It would have been nice to have a shower with bathtub (for after the run) and not just a shower, but the bathroom was functional enough.The business center consisted of only a desk with one computer and printer, but it worked fine when we needed it. A few issues with the HVAC...would run on for awhile. Not sure about WiFi as we didn't have any computer with us. The hotel has a small reception area, small restaurant, along with a small bar area also on the main floor, and they were working on a new restaurant on the top floor that was to open soon. Can't comment on the food, as we ate elsewhere in our travels. When we return, we will most definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: toria55
Reviews.Content: I agree with the positive comments made by others. Staff was freindly and helpful. Beds and bedding were ideal. The free Internet in the lobby is useful for a quick check of personal emails and, best of all, to print your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jona1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at this hotel for a night for her 30tyh birthday. Found a good rate on Travelzoo.com. Would highly recommend. The staff was courteous and friendly. Our room was on the 31st floor, so outside noise was never a problem. In fact, we heard no noise whatsoever. Of course the room is small (I've heard most are in NYC), but it had everything we could've wanted. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and everything was clean when we arrived. The location can't be beat, as it's just a few blocks from the heart of everything. Would highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CM002
Reviews.Content: Nice new clean room with an extremely comfortable bed. Friendly personnel and good housekeeping. A free bottle of mineral water every day. The tap is a bit of a design flaw but is manageable. Not a big room, but acceptable for Manhattan and the price level. Breakfast in the restaurant is to order, not a buffet. Reasonable price and good quality. The street is not nice, with a parole office and porn shops, but it seemed fairly safe and is close to Times Square, Hells Kitchen, Penn Station and many subway lines. I got a good deal on the Starwood website, so thought this was very good value for money overall.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: SanukSanuk
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat concerned about staying here given some of the reviews, but I'm glad I gave this property a try. My three-night stay during a recent business trip was excellent. The room was clean, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location was convenient to most of my meetings and restaurants. I really appreciate the free bottles of water that were replenished daily. I didn't use the free wireless Internet as I have my own portable connection, so I can't speak to the quality of the connection. As has been said, this is not a luxurious property, but I found it to be an excellent value. Despite the small room, I actually prefer it over the Westin Times Square, which I don't like because it's in the middle of the Times Square circus.This property is also nicer than the Four Points Chelsea which is not as conveniently located. My only disappointment is that room service is not 24/7. I arrived at 1am after a delayed flight and ended up going to bed hungry. Nevertheless, I would definitely stay here again for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Four Seasons, but it is Starwood comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TXStevePen
Reviews.Content: I don't stay in NY much, but when I have I find that the reasonably priced rooms are invariably small. Ditto here. The "Traditional" King room is tiny and as other reviewers have noted there is no space beside the sink to rest your toiletries.Being Platinum SPG and staying over the weekend we solved this by requesting and getting an upgrade to a suite. MUCH BETTER! The suites are two rooms put together with one as the sitting area and one as the bedroom. The bathroom is significantly better too. Get a suite if you can. Having said that, the Starwood beds are pure luxury. They also include a free bottle of water or two, and have showers instead of bathtubs with a shower head in them. Free coffee too. Room decor is modern; brown woods and leather. It's not harsh or depressing, just warm. Tried the restaurant in the lobby for dinner. It was comparable in price to the neighborhood eateries and was surprisingly good. We would probably have gone out to eat but it was 9 PM and about 10 degrees. In that case you can rely on the hotel restaurant. Dining room service was decent - although you pay for every soda or drink refill. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Lobby, if you care, is really small. Internet is free and effective. This isn't Four Seasons luxury, but it's sort of like a cruise ship - comfortable if you aren't going to be in your room all day. Don't know about pricing as we were on a loyalty reward.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: VBads
Reviews.Content: For me the most important part of a hotel is the bathroom, I chose to stay at the four Points because it has only just opened. There was a fair amount of noise from the construction of the building next door and they were also finalising the hotel bar on the top floor but other than that the staff were extremely friendly, the rooms were always kept tidy, the bathrooms were brand new and were in perfect working order.The beds were extremely comfortable if you enjoy soft body moulding matresses. I am considering buying one! The location is great as you are next to a subway and close enough to some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service...above and beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: dcrum2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here. I am a frequent NYC business traveller and always stay at the Startwood Brand hotels because I am a gold level member. Because the rates at this Four Points are so reasonable, I decided to try them out. I am very pleased. In particular, on the last day of my trip, I was in a great rush to catch a train at Penn Station (about 7 blocks and one avenue away). I was rushing back to my room to pick up my bags and run to the train station. I had about 10-15 minutes and it was going to be REALLY close. Alex, one of the bell men offered to run with me and carry my roller bag so that I didn't have to. We huffed and puffed all the way to Penn and I made my train! It was a miracle. But, more importantly, Alex and the folks at Four Points went ABOVE AND BEYOND my expectations. For this reason and many others (the beds are really comfortable and the rooms are sized nicely and beautifully renovated) I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to any friend or fellow business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel”
Reviews.Author: WestWildwood
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small as to be expected in NYC, but nicely appointed following the recent remodel. The king size bed did fill most of the room, but was very comfortable and welcome come the end of long days site-seeing. Street sounds were still audible from the 22nd floor, but not enough to wake you. I would agree that the neighborhood could be better, the "adult" shops are pretty sleezy and the lighting on 40th near the hotel could be better. Nearby 9th Ave. had some great restaurants that we did not even get a chance to explore given our time contstraints. The sinks in the bathroom while modern are lousy in design as water tends to spray while you wash your hands. An additional shelf in the bathroom would be helpful given the lack of counter space. I would return based on the comfort of the room and the price received. The staff was very helpful and friendly throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Goood little hidden spot”
Reviews.Author: 7Luvs2Travel77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and stayed here for the weekend and really enjoyed it… It’s very small and low key and on a sketchy street with sex shops on it but other than that it’s really nice. It was clean and comfy and served its purpose the restaurant was pretty good even though they serve me raw chicken! They compensated me with free breakfast the following morning. The location is great you’re just a cheap cab ride away from Chelsea Piers, Time square and walking distance from Madame Tsuands wax museum! (We went to all three over the weekend). There was construction going on outside of our rooms window (It really wasn’t noisy though) the staff was nice and accommodating to my boyfriend and I we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “noise location”
Reviews.Author: markupolo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location but don't think you are going to have a wonderful time.There is a construction right opposite,and the Central Bus Terminal cover must of the view from your window. The staff there was very unprofessional and unfriendly,besides that smelly rooms,the amenities were so simple,not Sheraton style,internet was very slow and didn't connect at all most of the time.My cellphone charger was stolen from the room. The guys at the reception are quiet young,not good experience in customer service;it is like paying for a Hotel and getting a Motel service...that is what it is. In the internet you can't find any picture of the hotel and the sorounding area...very doggy.

Reviews.Title: “What the [--]?”
Reviews.Author: MrsAriaT
Reviews.Content: Now really we are here and in the room right now. I did see a few reviews after we booked and at that time I wasnt concerned. Well I should have been and its too late now. We are here to celebrate New Years Eve and seeing the ball drop. I think they reel you in by using the words Times Square and thats is creative advertising. It is near times square, like two blocks up and two blocks over. I dont even know where to start with this damn place. I hope that this 400.00 a night rate is because it's New Years Eve. It cant be because of location because even though we are on a street its like an alley street. I have never been to a hotel and seen a room this small. Its like a 10X13. It doesnt have a closet! did you hear me? It doesnt have a real closet. It has an armoire in the corner of the room. No microvewave or frig. They have 33 floors and one vending machine and an ice machine that has both snacks and pop in the same machine and its in the basement. So yes you may have to go down 33 floors to get a fricking bucket of ice. The curtains dont close all the way. We basically have to keep the lights out because even with the shade down which is not a solid material you can see in the room. If we can see out then people can see in. the actual curtains are made not to even draw to the middle of the window. No view of anything but poor construction. The noise is nothing really unless you are a light sleeper. They advertise a bar and that darn place holds about 5 people. The pictures are very impressive and a total and complete joke.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: kw2405
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in early December. The Good: The location is perfect. Subway adjacent to pretty much every line. Rooms are big for NY. Large television. Quiet rooms. Room service was reasonably priced, quick and tasty. Hosuekeeping was great. The Bad: I arranged for an early check-in via both phone and e-mail. When we arrived, we were told we couldn't get into our room until 3. Annoying, solely because they had assured me before we arrived they could accommodate our request. You can't get a cab on 40th, you have to walk half a block. If you have a lot of luggage, this could be an issue. The water was turned off by the city at midnight two nights that we were there. Not a huge deal, but, one morning, we had NO water until 10am when it was supposed to be turned back on at 6. That really delayed our morning. Summary: I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. The price is right and the location is central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 2 night stay at the four points”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points midtown- times square for 2 nights. It is located across from the Port Authority bus station. Yes, you do pass by some questionable businesses on the half block walk to eighth avenue but it really isn't a big deal. We felt perfectly safe here. The hotel itself if new and in excellent condition. Room was clean but typically small as is usual in NY. The concierge was fairly helpful. The only problem that we encountered was the key cards were deactivated at noon even though we were given a 4 pm checkout. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: jojo56
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very new, clean, and nice. it's directly across the street from port authority, in btwn 8th and 9th ave. right now there is alot of construction going on outside the hotel. but once you get inside, you don't hear any of the outside noise anf forget that the neighborhood you are in is a little bit suspect. there is a xxx dvd store on the block, but the area is not known to be really dangerous, although i was not about to leave the hotel at 2am to find out. one of my issues was that the rooms are a bit cramped, but it is ny. and at the sink, you can't have hot water w/o having the water pressure at the highest. i wasn't sure how to wash my face w/o splashing water all over my clothes so i let the water fill the sink and then washed my face.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and New in Red Light District”
Reviews.Author: DCRE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during October--once for Columbus Day weekend with my wife and a second time by myself for the World Series. I used Starwood points each time and, when I requested an upgrade based upon my platinum status, I was given a suite on the top floor (on my second visit). The rooms are quite nice and everything is brand new. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside of the hotel, as others have noted, is its location amidst porn shops across from Port Authority. If you can tolerate the half-block walk back to a mainstream neighborhood, the hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's all relative in NYC.....”
Reviews.Author: Joski69
Reviews.Content: About me. Starwood Gold member and used points for two nights at this hotel. Rate I found on line was $315 per night which I felt was high for a Four Points property. Arrived just after 6 a.m. after a redeye from the west coast. Room availability at that hour is always a coin toss but they typically willl check you in when you are part of their "program." In this case hotel was completely sold out the night before. Seeing I was in a jam, the front desk clerk offered me a key to a room that had been vacated but not yet cleaned so I could change into a suit for me meeting. The clerk that came on shortly after, asked for my cell # and called me by 9:20 a.m. with a clean room ready for my use. I've been to 5 star hotels that do not offer that kind of service. Bellman and conierge were also helpful, friendly and cordial each time I encountered them. I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. Location - I had 25th floor at the back of the hotel facing the Westin at 51st and 8th. Noise was absolutely zero. I'm a little confused about the noise complaints from buses in and out of the port authority. There is some traffic in front of the hotel but I saw few buses and anything was rarely moving fast enough to make any noise due to proximity to traffic light and traffic. Perhaps it is louder on lower floors and/or facing another direction. I'm not sure what people expect in NY but there is nothing unsafe about this location. There is one or two adult bookstores on the block but never did I encounter anyone loitering and feel uncomfortable at any of the day or late night. Well located to attractions, dining, subway and Times Square. Best to walk 1/2 block to 8th or 9th to get a cab. They were not easy to find in front of the hotel. FInally, this place is great if you are traveling in or out of Newark airport. Very close to the tunnel and you can get a one way charter bus on Coach USA for $15. Door to door in under 40 minutes. Rooms - nice decor with minimalist approach to decorating. Beds were very comfortable and clean. Flat screen tv, clock radio with mp3 connection, plenty of outlets to plug things in. Bathroom lacks counter space as do most in Manhattan. Strangest thing to me was having the turn water pressure all of the way on to get hot water. The flat bottom sink would splash everywhere so use caution if you are fully dressed. Great glass shower with good pressure and lots of space. In room safe, iron and ironing board all in good working order. Two free bottles of water per day and wired/wireless internet included throughout the hotel. Yes - the room is small as most are in NYC. If you sit at the desk across from the bed, another person cannot pass behind you. You just dont get square footage in the city so I dont factor this as a negative. Hotel - did not use the gym. Lounge is small counter up front for breakfast and drinks in the evening with a tv for sports or news. Did not order room service or use small restaurant on premise so I cannot speak to food. All common areas were were cared for and clean. Not much negative to say about this hotel. If you can get a fair rate for this brand, it certainly is a little gem for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “lousy location makes this one to avoid”
Reviews.Author: jchicago
Reviews.Content: If you're nostalgic for the Times Square of porn shops and liquor stores, Four Points is up your alley. Those establishments, and the busy Port Authority bus station, make this area busy and seedy. Rooms are new and clean, with comfortable beds. Service is ok, though they didn't clean my room until almost 5pm. With so many better choices in NYC and Times Square area, don't bother unless rates are really low.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Loud, Slow Internet”
Reviews.Author: DogsLoveSalsa
Reviews.Content: The proximity to Times Square, Hells Kitchen, and the Bus Terminal are convenient. But it results in the hotel being pretty loud. The rooms are clean, modern, and pretty much no-frills. Beds are comfy. Internet is next to worthless, the few times i was able to get on, i ran a speed test with the resulting max download speed at 4.3kbs (modem from 1991). If you are a business traveler who needs a hotel with connectivity, don't stay her. If you are going to shows on broadway, or want to see the city and stay someplace cheap, this would be a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lamperose
Reviews.Content: We're just back from a 3-night stay at this hotel. We were lucky enough to have a room on the 20th floor so noise wasn't a problem at all (sign up to be a SPG member, it's free and you're more likely to get a room high up). From the 20th floor we had a nice enough view with no noise. The bed was the most comfortable bed I slept in and I already miss it! The room was a good size, neither small nor big and very clean. There's also a computer downstairs but the internet connection is quite slow. The complimentary bottle of water was a nice touch. In terms of the area, I knew that some reviews said that it was a shabby area. My husband didn't. I didn't tell him until we left, that every single day we passed the Parole office and two adult stores and he was actually surprised and never noticed them! I really don't think that the neighbourhood is that bad. OK it's not like in the upper west side but for the price we paid for the hotel ($440 all taxes included for 3 nights) it was really good value for money with a great room with virtually most of the metro stations within 2 to 10 minutes walk. Ooh and we also went on the roof, 34th floor, great view on Jersey, and the times square area!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds! The neighborhood is not that seedy, but it is noisy, so bring your ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came for an event at that Marriott Marquis, but they were booked on Wednesday and Thursday, so we had to look for alternate lodging where we could use our SPG points. The closest available hotel was the Four Points Midtown. I read the reviews and was a little concerned about the neighborhood, but figured it was only two nights and you are basically just there to sleep, right? I believe this hotel went through a renovation not long ago, so the outside and lobby look new. The lobby is small with a small concierge desk, check-in desk and a tiny bar/coffee lounge to the right. Check in was pretty quick and we headed up to room 903.... The room was simply remodeled, but you could tell that it was an old, remodeled room, if that makes sense. It's small...there isn't room for two people to walk between the end of the bed and the deks at the same time. We had a king bed (which I must say was VERY comfortable, along with the pillows and linens - by far the best feature in the room!) with two nightstands; an armoire to hang your clothes and housed the safe, iron and ironing board and coffee maker; a desk with chair, a flat panel TV and a side chair and lamp. The bath was very small and plain, but did the job. Not fancy. but clean and like I said, the bed was fantastic! At this point I was pretty happy with the hotel, and we went out exploring... SO - onto the 'hood - don't let the reviews saying that it's a seedy neighborhood and that it's unsafe scare you....it's really not that bad! Directly across the street is the Port Authority with buses coming in and out most hours of the day - so expect noise. Quite a lot of it actually. Yes, and just a few steps out the door of the hotel and to the right is a Parole Office but I honestly never saw anyone hanging around there. Nor did I see any shady looking characters hanging around the Adult DVD stores. Just keep walking by and you'll be fine... It's about a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square, depending if you hit stoplights or not (and how fast you walk!) There are tons of convenience stores, restaurants (fast food and sit-down) and a Starbucks on the way. We didn't have any issues with the air conditioning/fan, our water temperature or pressure - or anything else funky for that matter. So far so good, right?...until we went to bed. Oh Lord! It was so loud that I kept getting up to check to make sure the window wasn't open! I am somewhat of a light sleeper, but typically when I'm traveling and I walk many, many miles in a day, I crash pretty hard. But it didn't matter how tired I was, I absolutely couldn't get to sleep because of the noise - mostly coming from the Port Authority across the street. Luckily I remembered I had some ear plugs so I popped those in and managed to get about 5 hours of sleep. Now, I have to say that my boyfriend is a very heavy sleeper and could fall asleep on a tarp in the middle of a construction site, so he didn't have any problems. Perhaps the noise wouldn't be as bad on a higher floor? My suggestion would be to avoid the street side on the 9th floor - unless you sleep like my boyfriend! Or have ear plugs. With that....Overall, even with the noise, I think this hotel is a good value for it's location. Feel free to contact me with any questions... Happy Travels! LisaMpls

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: lisafinz
Reviews.Content: Having been to NY at least a dozen times before, I have stayed in various locations in the city depending on what I was going there for. This time was for a quick 1 night to see a show with a friend, so decided that we really didn't want to be more than a 5-10 minute walk to Times Sq. area. This hotel fit perfectly! As others have mentioned, the location is great - 5 mins. to TS and theatre district, but some may be a bit put-off by the semi-sketchy street/neighborhood where it's located (ie adult book store, Port Authority bus station). But don't let that scare you! It was perfectly fine and we, as 2 woman traveling alone, didn't feel threatened or awkward. It's NY after all - full of all kinds of characters, but that's the charm. The interior of the hotel was nice - simply furnished and functional, with the MOST comfortable beds and pillows. Really! Our room was located on the 16th floor and had a lovely view. The staff, from Reception to Concierge, to Room Service, were all exceptionally nice. Just a couple of other nice features in the room: window that opens just a bit, an Ipod docking station to play music, bottled water and large flat-screen tv. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and would certainly suggest this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering if you can get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: ChessAdvisor
Reviews.Content: The Four Points Times Square is in a great location (if you want to stay in midtown), the rooms are well appointed and the staff are friendly. You get a cool flatscreen tv on the wall, the beds are super comfortable and there's a small gym in the basement. They deserve respect for offering free wifi and free bottled water. On the down side - and it's hard to quantify exactly why - I was put in mind of the "Linton Travel Tavern" during my stay... I just found it a bit depressing. (Big caveat to the following comments is that they probably apply to many Manhattan hotels) The rooms are quite small, the building is wedged in pretty tight to those around so you look out your window and find yourself staring someone in the face who's doing the photocopying in the office opposite, small corridors, cheap products in the bathroom, smell of stale cigarettes in corridors and lifts/elevators etc. As others have observed, the beds are very comfortable although I was bitten all over my right arm during one night so it appears that there were a few "house guests" in the room... Overall it's fine and if you get a good deal then it would serve you well for a stopover or short stay; especially if you don't expect any nice surprises or cleverly thought out design details.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Sheraton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: FormerNewYorkerCa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently remodeled I believe. The room was small but had all the amenities needed. The Sheraton beds are the best!! The staff was quite helpful & friendly. The food in the restaurant was also wonderful. The one negative is that the shower head is placed too high. Standing on my tipee toes I still had difficulty moving it. I am 5'4".

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal”
Reviews.Author: lorirk123
Reviews.Content: The hotel front staff weren't very friendly, but for the price and location it was a great place to stay. The room was cleaned and very comfortable. I would stay there again and would reccomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: USlover
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Bus terminal with buses from Newark airport for only 25 $ roundtrip, nice rooms with excellent beds, friendly staff. We stayed here 5 adults and 1 child in 2 rooms. Loved it. The only thing is the pornstores on the way to the hotel, but it was ok anyway,not much action going on around them anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK!”
Reviews.Author: karaseksrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights Oct 1-4th. The room was clean granted but very small even for NYC standards. I have been in NYC 3x before at three different hotels and all were much roomier. The maid service was poor...staff threw out receipts left neatly stacked on the night stand and did not replace the plastic glasses. The bathroom was very tiny. Great for a one person stay but definitely not more then 2 per room. Very close to everything. The Bus terminal was very handy as direct transport to the Bruce Springsteen concert at Giants Stadium in NJ was from there. Did not feel unsafe at all getting to/from the hotel. Staff were generally friendly but seemed like they were spaced out most of the time and did not know answers to basic questions. The best rate we fund was for 208/ngt and the only reason we stayed here was for a fee night offered to us by SPG.

Reviews.Title: “Great value /totally safe area”
Reviews.Author: amsenny
Reviews.Content: We booked with the re-opening deal of $115 per night. That in itself, made the stay great, but we were plesantly surprised with the size of the room and the great view. We could see Times Square from our room. Our room was very clean and the beds were great. I see some reviews mention the adult stores on the streets. Yes, they were there, however I never once felt unsafe. I loved the fact that Times Square was a block away. The Port Authority Bus Terminal was across the street which was kind of handy because there were lots of affordable resturants and shops. Not a bad deal. This hotels grand re-opening deal allowed my family to extend our vacation and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fatal Errors”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: For all of the good things one can say about this relatively new hotel (eg, incredibly comfortable beds, smart design for such small rooms, friendly staff), there are a couple of major problems that make it impossible to stay here again. First is the air-conditioning. As previous reviewers have noted, when the cool (or hot) air kicked in, the sound was so loud that I was awakened every 5-10 minutes during the night. There is NO option to keep the fan on when the cool or warm air is also desired (which would at least keep the noise at a constant level). How could a new hotel adopt such an antiquated system? And why does using the TV remote turn the a/c off?? Second is the in-room internet. Yes, it is free, but in this case you get what you pay for. The wired option is so slow that doing any work was all but impossible (staff advised that too many people are on the system and suggested that I go down to the business center to work). The connection was non-existent for the wireless option. I stayed for 4 nights and not once was the connection "normal" (much less high-speed, as advertised). I leave this hotel both tired and frustrated.

Reviews.Title: “clean, reasonable, convenient, but nothing exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: ezelion
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just the lasy night (of a 5-night trip) with my partner. It was a very clean, reasonably-priced, room that was really conveniently located. I didn't mind the somewhat grungy 'hood, but felt the hotel could have been better 'formatted' for its location including not having such a massive bed in such a time room and a more efficiently designed lobby to cater to the small size of the lobby and the large number of guests. Still, I'd stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: missyschmid82
Reviews.Content: lovely clean hotel in an excellent location.port authority is right across the street as is a 24 store/chemest.theres a lovely cafe in the port authority for breakfast as the food in the hotel is pricey. the rooms are small enough but perfect if you were just showering and sleeping there as we did.the t.v in the room was great even if the remote kept switching on the very noisy air con.the bed was the most comfortable ever but the pillows were way too soft with no support and they didnt offer an alternative for people who need support from their pillow. the bar in the hotel isnt really a bar its a small alcove to the side of the reception area with approx. 3 tables.
